commit_message:
fix functional gate

new keystone libs are breaking the functional tests. it seems
keystonemiddleware is implicitly being loaded when calling
prepare_service. we don't really need to call this so let's see
if it changes anything if we stop calling it.

Closes-Bug: #1522166
Change-Id: If01bcb6543fe164d79f785e20668106308244f75

commit_message:
Rename bash libraries for tox+bashate

This patch renames a few libraries whose names don't match *.sh. This
allows tox to easily find all bash libraries and check them with
bashate.

Change-Id: Icf231dacc3fa78d20f1b48a4befb917a1d15dd3d

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-27 10:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/backend/swift.pp', 'spec/classes/glance_backend_swift_spec.rb'], 'message': "Update Glance Swift backend configuration

Currently, when Glance uses Swift as backend, all references to
images saved in database with credentials, like:
swift+http://services%3Aglance:EF3tluYM@192.168.0.2:5000/v2.0/glance/049cd701-77

The problem is that when we want to change Glance credentials we can't use
old images anymore, because new credentials and creds in database are
different. For resolving this issue was implemented patch in Glance [1]
and couple of patches in Glance_Store [2,3]. The main goal is using
separate section (file with such section) for providing credentials
for access to Swift and do not place reference with credentials to
database.

All changes above are covered in docs for configuring Swift backend [4].

Also glance_cache_config now is not using for configuring Swift backend,
hence all related parameters for this config removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98722/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/193422/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/108036/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242583/

Change-Id: Iaf0c1c6f2188c84267e41d2d4f9bda0dbf3dccad
Related-bug: #1499754
(cherry picked from commit 09fec793da629e4d7c18265149a8347c0a293ff7)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update Glance Swift backend configuration

Currently, when Glance uses Swift as backend, all references to
images saved in database with credentials, like:
swift+http://services%3Aglance:EF3tluYM@192.168.0.2:5000/v2.0/glance/049cd701-77

The problem is that when we want to change Glance credentials we can't use
old images anymore, because new credentials and creds in database are
different. For resolving this issue was implemented patch in Glance [1]
and couple of patches in Glance_Store [2,3]. The main goal is using
separate section (file with such section) for providing credentials
for access to Swift and do not place reference with credentials to
database.

All changes above are covered in docs for configuring Swift backend [4].

Also glance_cache_config now is not using for configuring Swift backend,
hence all related parameters for this config removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/98722/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/193422/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/108036/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242583/

Change-Id: Iaf0c1c6f2188c84267e41d2d4f9bda0dbf3dccad
Related-bug: #1499754
(cherry picked from commit 09fec793da629e4d7c18265149a8347c0a293ff7)

commit_message:
FORWARD rules for public network

CentOS7 comes with pre-defined REJECT rule in FORWARD chain
that doesn't allow to access external networks from public
network.

When deploying ISO with virtualbox scripts slave nodes are trying
to connect to external networks via public net, with default
gateway on master node. However, they can't establish a connection
because there is no explicit rule in FORWARD chain to allow it,
so they are rejected.

This commit adds rules to allow connection to ext networks in
that usecase.

Compatible with CentOS6 & CentOS7 master node.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Change-Id: I5b61ae6e7562ea5b446809027c487acc11119889

commit_message:
Fix wrong use of os_package_type

https://review.openstack.org/241615 introduced a bug in
Red Hat based distros, with the consequence of collectstatic
and compress being never done. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I69a6fa9ade86904f2301e057d9bd9800e905b8d3
Closes-Bug: #1519715
(cherry picked from 3beef9d0c62bc548485e150883a5b5004951efc3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 22:10:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[Tempest] Refactor base tests for share creation

Our Tempest jobs run out timeout very often. So, we need to make our
tests be completed sooner than it is now.
Currently, we have two tests with simple share creation for each
share protocol. And the only difference - usage of different
microversions that influence only view. So, combine these two tests
into one verifying both microversions in one test creating only one
share. In case of Generic driver, we test the same things reducing
expanses for 2 share creations.

commit_message:
[Tempest] Refactor base tests for share creation

Our Tempest jobs run out timeout very often. So, we need to make our
tests be completed sooner than it is now.
Currently, we have two tests with simple share creation for each
share protocol. And the only difference - usage of different
microversions that influence only view. So, combine these two tests
into one verifying both microversions in one test creating only one
share. In case of Generic driver, we test the same things reducing
expanses for 2 share creations.

Change-Id: I21001fe742fd78a2f236a43511fc1351002259f6

commit_message:
Add mks enablement for python client

mks is enabled in microversion 2.8 in nova, python novaclient
can enable it so later when we bump MAXVERSION, it can be used.

Change-Id: I87db65ea87c0351f7f9fe023f167f27daf94df30

[{'created': '2015-12-01 21:35:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Have pep8 run pep8-constraints

pep8 is broken, because pylint is pinned at 1.4.4, but astroid (a
dependency) is floating and the latest version, 1.4.1 is incompatible
with pyllint 1.4.4.

However, pep8-constraints works, because the upper-constraints file
restricts astroid to 1.3.8.

For local testing, this commit has pep8 run the same commands as the
pep8-constraints target, giving the developers a warm fuzzy feeling
of the old and easy to type 'tox -e pep8', but having the command
actually work. :)

Change-Id: I1c2fa31ba888408e5def925c3c6e4f0f3f5088fe
Partial-Bug: #1521766
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Have pep8 run pep8-constraints

pep8 is broken, because pylint is pinned at 1.4.4, but astroid (a
dependency) is floating and the latest version, 1.4.1 is incompatible
with pyllint 1.4.4.

However, pep8-constraints works, because the upper-constraints file
restricts astroid to 1.3.8.

For local testing, this commit has pep8 run the same commands as the
pep8-constraints target, giving the developers a warm fuzzy feeling
of the old and easy to type 'tox -e pep8', but having the command
actually work. :)

Change-Id: I1c2fa31ba888408e5def925c3c6e4f0f3f5088fe
Partial-Bug: #1521766

commit_message:
Case with same disk ids covered in VolumeManager

For NVMe disks udevadm on the CentOs returns the same ids,
thus disks can't be distincted. Disk matching workflow
is changed. Now we use composite identifier built from
disk id and path for workaround issue with same ids.
If disk don't matched by the composite key we are trying to
matching them by id. If matching by id failed we are trying
to match disk by path.

Closes-Bug: #1503987
Change-Id: I09d6514e9749f964bb2d697b0adaf9dcb2b0ac73

commit_message:
Workaround for detection of CentOS NVMe disks added

On CentOs udevadm returns the same ids for NVMe disks.
For handling this case we use matched by name devices.

Change-Id: Iecca4c188fa148be4c4857767a8b57b60def8be9
Partial-Bug: #1503987

commit_message:
Pause VM during live migration as migration action

This patch updates pause VM during live migraton specification and
changes API POST call to be a migration action instead of a server
action.

blueprint pause-vm-during-live-migration

Change-Id: Ia44763854933096814ce4c25069d2f58ae7d8def

commit_message:
Not update flavor in Server if id changed by name

Currently if flavor was defined with ID, and after that
flavor is updated with it's name, Server begins update,
but nova raises error about incorrect resize. Add check
that flavors is realy different.

Change-Id: I4f284703d4cb80ab4de7a57e3b42503ab3bde586
Closes-bug: #1518232

commit_message:
Add 'sync' action to DB callback

This new action allows the DB driver code when
its waiting for changes to signal the controller to do full sync
process.
This can be used for cases where some Exceptions happend in the DB
driver "publish-subscribe" listener, or the driver detected that
it missed some updates.

Change-Id: I8ff6444e64cda53463987623f83ef0d9d8173883

commit_message:
Honor rabbitmq username/password

If a rabbitmq username/password were set in undercloud.conf previously,
they were not honored, and all services would fail to connect to rabbit.
Also cleans up the way we include rabbit in the puppet manifest to bring
it inline with how it's done for the Overcloud.

Change-Id: If851db7edf3e2fc5fbd0722ebf3df6e5b16681a0
(cherry picked from commit 3c97a6c9b6283633fcfc98ee9a9df3b772ac47e4)

commit_message:
puppet: restart mysql if config changes

The MySQL service should be restarted when things change.

See https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql#restart

commit_message:
Support docker images in client

Add docker format to list of supported formats in glanceclient.
So the client can create docker images and validate them in case
if image schema is not available.

Closes-bug: #1519402

subject: Added to ability to set mtu for lxcbr0
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 16:14:16.000000000', 'files': ['templates/lxc-net-bridge.cfg.j2', 'templates/lxc-openstack.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Added to ability to set mtu for lxcbr0

The lxc_host role overrides the configuration
done by the system administrator on the host.

If mtu was defined in /etc/lxc/ and in the
system network interfaces, then these configurations
will be overriden.

This commit should allow the deployer to set the
mtu for its lxcbr0 network, by setting the variable
lxc_net_mtu.

Fixes-Bug: #1518303

Change-Id: I42ab3d0a2c20ae94335de195cdb14579d9f59f5f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Added to ability to set mtu for lxcbr0

The lxc_host role overrides the configuration
done by the system administrator on the host.

If mtu was defined in /etc/lxc/ and in the
system network interfaces, then these configurations
will be overriden.

This commit should allow the deployer to set the
mtu for its lxcbr0 network, by setting the variable
lxc_net_mtu.

Fixes-Bug: #1518303

Change-Id: I42ab3d0a2c20ae94335de195cdb14579d9f59f5f

commit_message:
Numerous improvements in the documentation

* Flatten the directory structure (we don't have that many doc files)
* Dropped HTTP-API from the root so that we don't maintain 2 copies
* Fixed links all over the place
* Leave one copy of README text in the root and include it in docs
* Update 'tox -epep8' to also check docs

Change-Id: Ic14cb73668544be27c6b96b384f93b239e49acfd

subject: Simplify tox.ini bashate call
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 18:22:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Simplify tox.ini bashate call

The find arguments tox uses to identify files for bashate to check miss
some files that should be checked and include several files that should
not be checked.

For users and developers, it is not obvious if their files are going to
be checked or not because layers of criteria are stacked on top of
each other.

I propose a simple rule: outside of dot dirs and the doc folder, files
whose names match *.sh are checked, the rest is not. This was the
initial plan, too, and we renamed several files because of that. For
the few library files that we missed at the time, the proper fix is to
rename them, too.

Change-Id: If4d35b4e80fed54c69cbe4981a87b0c2a7338b9b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Simplify tox.ini bashate call

The find arguments tox uses to identify files for bashate to check miss
some files that should be checked and include several files that should
not be checked.

For users and developers, it is not obvious if their files are going to
be checked or not because layers of criteria are stacked on top of
each other.

I propose a simple rule: outside of dot dirs and the doc folder, files
whose names match *.sh are checked, the rest is not. This was the
initial plan, too, and we renamed several files because of that. For
the few library files that we missed at the time, the proper fix is to
rename them, too.

Change-Id: If4d35b4e80fed54c69cbe4981a87b0c2a7338b9b

subject: use plain-text file for launchpad credentials
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 16:45:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'use plain-text file for launchpad credentials

Authenticating to use launchpad now defaults to an encrypted keyring,
which requires the user to enter a keyring password
interactively. Switch to using a plain-text file explicitly to bypass
this to improve automation. The hard-coded path to the file corresponds
to where it was created by default before the switch to keyring, and we
can add an option to specify the filename later to make the scripts work
in the CI system.

Change-Id: Ifed22f7c178b1e62e7b5e95d0f8810633ba46fb1
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-02 17:04:32.000000000', 'files': ['releasetools/cmds/launchpad_login.py', 'releasetools/cmds/add_comment.py', 'process_bugs.py', 'releasetools/launchpadutils.py'], 'message': 'use plain-text file for launchpad credentials

Authenticating to use launchpad now defaults to an encrypted keyring,
which requires the user to enter a keyring password
interactively. Enable using a plain-text file explicitly or via an
environment variable to bypass this to improve automation.

Change-Id: Ifed22f7c178b1e62e7b5e95d0f8810633ba46fb1
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
use plain-text file for launchpad credentials

Authenticating to use launchpad now defaults to an encrypted keyring,
which requires the user to enter a keyring password
interactively. Enable using a plain-text file explicitly or via an
environment variable to bypass this to improve automation.

Change-Id: Ifed22f7c178b1e62e7b5e95d0f8810633ba46fb1

commit_message:
add support for ZUUL_CACHE_DIR

If ZUUL_CACHE_DIR is set, pass it to zuul-cloner to use the
directory as the source for projects instead of going to the
network.

There's a related patch to use ZUUL_CACHE_DIR as the default for the
--cache option's value in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/220602/.

Change-Id: I010e67d5475332fe42fd110a71873c27a2fd79f5

commit_message:
Remove db and object usage in cli.commands.deployment module

In order to make Rally as a Service, rally CLI modules do
not allow to work with rally.common.db and rally.common.objects.

This patch remove rally.common.db and rally.common.objects
usage in cli.commands.deployment moudle, and make necessary change
on unit tests.

Change-Id: Ie72b4d6a8e6f068e84a388fa1ef8138abbe06a27

commit_message:
Fixup requirements

We shouldn't have requirements in tox.ini, because update-requirements
doesn't edit tox.ini. Further, we don't need to redundantly install
requirements.txt, as tox installs the sdist it builds, and that
contains those requirements.

Change-Id: I158ea10f104549dd4f0f3ff777b39feb5886642e

commit_message:
Set origin/stable/liberty to the REF we want to build

Internally delorean does "git reset --hard origin/<branch>" so we
need to set this so it stays as the ZUUL set revision. We were
already doing this for master.

In the long term we should extent delorean to accept git references
to be built.

Change-Id: I2f69207465a953c259d539e557072ef9d5164752
(cherry picked from commit c3f06d1bee1de7300a8f5d3a95f0b38343516a0a)

commit_message:
Adding commit id support when RECLONING

If you specify a specific commit as a *_BRANCH variable,
the existing reclone logic fails to recognise the
commit-id as valid as it is not a tag or branch

Change-Id: I4425a9c4bfbceb0c6cf3bf5734b15cc4d5a98106
Closes-Bug: #1506804

subject: Switched power state and provision state.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 19:21:12.000000000', 'files': ['app/view/ironic/node_list.html'], 'message': "Switched power state and provision state.

The provision state of a node appears to be a more important state
for an ironic node- whether it's available, inspected, etc. As such,
it makes sense to put it in a more prominent location in the node
list.

Change-Id: I6ad19b94a05ce7c22a4e53304e09348b1c128646
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switched power state and provision state.

The provision state of a node appears to be a more important state
for an ironic node- whether it's available, inspected, etc. As such,
it makes sense to put it in a more prominent location in the node
list.

Change-Id: I6ad19b94a05ce7c22a4e53304e09348b1c128646

commit_message:
Added API Version Header

This patch adds a static Ironic API Version Header, in lieu of
proper version negotiation. A full implementation of version
negotiation will require either an update to angular-resource
(currently under review), or switching from using ng-Resource to
Restangular or js-data.

Change-Id: I76bcff55b4d6bc39758701c30579f25a06b972d7

subject: Enroll Node
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-09 23:41:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enroll Node

This patch creates a very simple "enroll node" process, which
permits the selection of a driver, as well as setting that drivers'
properties based on the results received from the API. It adds
an IronicDriverProperties resource to expose individual driver
properties to the UI. Unfortunately the driver properties do not
contain type, validation, or required data in a machine-readable
fashion, so these are not applied to the form generation.

Editing a driver's properties, or un-enrolling a node, is not yet
supported.

Change-Id: Idd7015937f908b5567717a8d34fa4958ac939041

Change-Id: Idd7015937f908b5567717a8d34fa4958ac939041

commit_message:
Enroll Node

This patch creates a very simple "enroll node" process, which
permits the selection of a driver, as well as setting that drivers'
properties based on the results received from the API.

New generic mocks to simulate an API have been added to support
necessary tests, and coverage thresholds have been updated.

Editing a driver's properties, or un-enrolling a node, is not yet
supported.

Change-Id: Idd7015937f908b5567717a8d34fa4958ac939041

Removed ports

Feedback from initial UX research indicates that ports are not
relevant as a primary resource in the UI. This patch removes them.

Added IronicDriverProperties resource

This resource loads from {ironic}/drivers/properties?driver_name=foo,
to provide a list of the supported properties for a given driver. Tests
have been provided, and coverage thresholds have been updated.

subject: Added Ironic API result transformation.

When the ironic API returns an error, it is actually a JSON object
with a single field named "error_message", which contains a JSON

This patch ensures that the internal object is properly decoded
before it is passed through to the UI. Tests have been provided.

commit_message:
Added Ironic API result transformation.

When the ironic API returns an error, it is actually a JSON object
with a single field named "error_message", which contains a JSON
encoded object (doubly encoded) with the actual error message.
This must be decoded twice to be easily accessible to the UI.

When the ironic API returns a list response, it is actually a JSON
object with a single field named as the resource that was requested.
This needs to be reduced, so that the list response is an array rather
than an object.

This patch adds a result transformation chain, independent of
ironic resources, that applies all likely transformations in a chain.
Tests have been provided.

Change-Id: I4deed08fe3f3a65f4f48b54620c791f0c3605238

commit_message:
$$configuration mock

This patch renames the jasmine test directory to 'spec', adds a new
test directory named 'mock', and adds a mock module that will load
some test defaults into the $$configurationProvider, for those test
suites that don't want to duplicate setup.

Change-Id: I9ed9d8870cdec536f5fd1b5b6d97db6d097d7e2f

Adds the quobyte protocol alongside nfs, glusterfs, etc. .

commit_message:
Revert "Port xio driver to Python 3"

This reverts commit 8e527c806b7731835a28a9ae95f52ce74e3cffa9.

This patch broke the X-IO driver.  The CI was reporting as Failure and yet it was still approved.

Change-Id: I40d5598ab8cbf5b7a2c8df97692de78adf8157d1

commit_message:
Fixed tense consistency (used past) in statuses

In several places in Watcher, there are statuses which corresponds
to a status in the respective life cycle. There were used past tense
everywhere, except "SUCCESS" which was written in present tense.

So I searched for all the occurences of this state, and replaced them
with their past tense form.

Change-Id: Ic41def96d1a608da06a1e394e24704d4f06ab32a
Closes-Bug: #1520276

subject: Fix tools/get_action_list.py
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-01 19:53:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Update tools/get_action_list.py to support trove

This patch does several things:

 -adds 'trove' to the list of supported services

 -fixes an issue where trove_base now uses the Manager class
  instead of HookableMixin.

 -The trove Client class now requires to arguments.

With these options I am again able to use get_action_list.py.

NOTE: The critical error here was actually the HookableMixin
exception in that it prevents you from using this tool with
other services.

 -fixes an issue where trove_base now uses the Manager class
  instead of HookableMixin. This would actually prevent
  tools/get_action_list.py from running any service...
  not just trove.

 -adds 'trove' to the list of supported services by
  using CLIENTS.keys() instead of the inline list
  where 'trove' was previously missing

 -The trove Client class now requires to arguments.

With these options I am again able to use get_action_list.py.

NOTE: The critical error here was actually the HookableMixin
exception in that it prevents you from using this tool with
other services.

Change-Id: I3207e1379101757b282260949a48d22fe193fe85
Closes-bug: #1521740
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Fix tools/get_action_list.py

This patch does several things:

 -fixes an issue where trove_base now uses the Manager class
  instead of HookableMixin. This would actually prevent
  tools/get_action_list.py from running any service...
  not just trove.

 -adds 'trove' to the list of supported services by
  using CLIENTS.keys() instead of the inline list
  where 'trove' was previously missing

 -The trove Client class now requires to arguments.

With these options I am again able to use get_action_list.py.

NOTE: The critical error here was actually the HookableMixin
exception in that it prevents you from using this tool with
other services.

Change-Id: I3207e1379101757b282260949a48d22fe193fe85
Closes-bug: #1521740

commit_message:
Fix LVM snapshot creation error reporting

If LVM snapshot creation failed, freezer continued
without raising an error and tried to remove
the snapshot - which wasn't created - and won't
take the backup. It only reports that lvm snapshot
remove failed.

Closes-Bug: #1497224

Change-Id: Ic66ba6d6bae21068bef8116644ea15783b176823

commit_message:
UI: Execution pagination on client side

* added execution list
  client side pagination
  which rely on the server api
* both next and previous iteration
  are supported
* items per page are coherent to
  user settings

Screenshots:
http://pasteboard.co/2p5A512S.png
http://pasteboard.co/2p5Cd1qW.png

Partially implements blueprint: mistral-dashboard-executions-screen

Change-Id: If13482d8fe62e4989dd1a62874c88c08c3e43d54

commit_message:
Fix a column name "protocol/port" to "port/protocol"

Fix neutron security-group-rule-list's result.
The column name "protocol/port" had been reversed from value,
and value is correct.

Change-Id: I5aac35bfd717af4adf97c48f19b90b12357df71c
Closes-bug: #1521819

Remove tests with 'gre' network

- Remove 'gre' tests from tests_strength/test_neutron.py
- Change 'gre' to 'tun' in test_image_based.py
- Change 'gre' to 'tun' in test_pullrequest.py

commit_message:
Improve Tempest tests for consistency groups

Resource setup for 'ConsistencyGroupActionsTest' test class is
inefficient. It creates three separate shares waiting for 'available'
status going one by one. It can be improved by creating three shares
at once and then waiting for their status. So, update resource setup
for mentioned class and do related minor updates for tests of that
class.

Change-Id: Ibd82796866851cba22b417fad34f41dc2aa756e8
Closes-Bug: #1493406

commit_message:
[TEST] Run Tempest with v2.6 having v2.7

Run Tempest tests using microversion 2.6 to test old APIs
after port of old URLs to new ones.

DO NOT MERGE. For testing purposes only!

Change-Id: I50421529347399e314e920fe89496405614302cb

The current script doesn't work under py3. It is using some features
that are deprecated in py3. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I475ebd721c5a49a96f86450d4972ea21a42a50b7
Closes-Bug: #1521837
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix tox -e docs build in py3

The current script doesn't work under py3. It is using some features
that are deprecated in py3. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I475ebd721c5a49a96f86450d4972ea21a42a50b7
Closes-Bug: #1521837

commit_message:
Start flannel-config.service before flannel-docker-bridge.service

Flannel-config.service should start before
flannel-docker-bridge.service. Flannel-config.service creates
flannel config in etcd which is needed by flannel-bridge.service.

Change-Id: I5af5f90f5078e183753f9e3207be1731145e7e06
Closes-Bug: #1520734

Change-Id: I95a6fa4fe8f5d1a95b68d106bead732a8d43c85e
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-10-23 12:17:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Adopt perestroika to build fuel packages from custom source path

In case if we are not using gerrit we need to re-define path
to source code. There are a number of variables that must be
defined explicitly, otherwise custom build will fail.
   Example:

    REMOTE_REPO_HOST=perestroika-repo-tst.infra.mirantis.net \
    RPM_OS_REPO_PATH=mos-repos/centos/mos8.0-centos7-fuel/os/ \
    PROJECT_NAME=mos \
    PROJECT_VERSION=8.0 \
    PACKAGENAME=openstack/fuel-agent \
    SRC_PROJECT=openstack/fuel-agent \
    SOURCE_BRANCH=master \
    CUSTOM_SRC_PATH=~/fuel-main/build/repos/fuel-agent \
               ./build-fuel-rpm.sh

Change-Id: I95a6fa4fe8f5d1a95b68d106bead732a8d43c85e

   Example:

   1) rpm

    PROJECT_NAME=mos \

    PROJECT_NAME=mos \

    SRC_PROJECT=openstack/fuel-agent \
    SOURCE_BRANCH=master \

commit_message:
Adapt perestroika to build fuel packages from custom source path

In case if we are not using gerrit we need to re-define path
to source code. There are a number of variables that must be
defined explicitly, otherwise custom build will fail.
   Example:

   1) rpm
    REMOTE_REPO_HOST=perestroika-repo-tst.infra.mirantis.net \
    RPM_OS_REPO_PATH=mos-repos/centos/mos8.0-centos7-fuel/os/ \
    PROJECT_NAME=mos \
    PROJECT_VERSION=8.0 \
    PACKAGENAME=openstack/fuel-agent \
    SRC_PROJECT=openstack/fuel-agent \
    SOURCE_BRANCH=master \
    CUSTOM_SRC_PATH=~/fuel-main/build/repos/fuel-agent \
               ./build-fuel-rpm.sh

   2) deb
    REMOTE_REPO_HOST=perestroika-repo-tst.infra.mirantis.net \
    DEB_REPO_PATH=/mos-repos/ubuntu/8.0/ \
    DEB_DIST_NAME=mos8.0 \
    COMPONENTS='main restricted' \
    PROJECT_NAME=mos \
    PROJECT_VERSION=8.0 \
    PACKAGENAME=openstack/fuel-agent \
    SRC_PROJECT=openstack/fuel-agent \
    SOURCE_BRANCH=master \
    CUSTOM_SRC_PATH=~/fuel-main/build/repos/fuel-agent \
               ./build-fuel-deb.sh

commit_message:
Add Manual cleaning support to iLO drivers

This spec proposes to support certain functionalities to be invoked
as part of manual cleaning process through iLO drivers to manage
HP Proliant nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Debayan Ray <debayan.ray@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I18dfff15bc2879e69cc3d3528cd4e6d14290b4d8

commit_message:
Remove py26 support

As of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.
Closes-Bug: 1519510

Change-Id: I680043c48c75a50b3ef8eed4f22e97dca029c477

commit_message:
Remove circle reference

We can not import magnum.api.validation because of circle reference.

We can reproduce this bug by "tox -egenconfig" or importing
magnum.api.validation in a python console.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "magnum/api/validation.py", line 20, in <module>
    from magnum.api.controllers.v1 import utils as api_utils
  File "magnum/api/controllers/v1/__init__.py", line 30, in <module>
    from magnum.api.controllers.v1 import baymodel
  File "magnum/api/controllers/v1/baymodel.py", line 29, in <module>
    from magnum.api import validation
ImportError: cannot import name validation

Change-Id: Ib73d7f1d989b9bc860bfadafa52e9a83996f5de9
Closes-Bug: #1521840

commit_message:
Sanity check module

This module will be collection of basic checks to ensure that module
is running. After deploying service (like keystone) we will run sanity
checks for given service.

Change-Id: If7dc7f8a1ce1c3f93fc51d8327a55ef655b0de00
Partially-Implements: blueprint sanity-check-container

subject: adds tools/cleanup-containers regex support
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 23:02:49.000000000', 'files': ['tools/cleanup-containers'], 'message': 'adds tools/cleanup-containers regex support

- this change extends the tools/cleanup-containers script to
  support a grep extended regex as a first paramater.
- if tools/cleanup-containers is called with a grep extended
  regex string as a first paramater, only containers mataching
  that regex will be cleaned up.
- e.g. tools/cleanup-containers "neutron|openvswitch"
  will cleanup all container whoes name contains either neutron
  or openvswitch.

Change-Id: Iadb68c0a8de40e9ec2c0a27568e3a372ec0e8303
Closes-Bug: #1522168
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
adds tools/cleanup-containers regex support

- this change extends the tools/cleanup-containers script to
  support a grep extended regex as a first paramater.
- if tools/cleanup-containers is called with a grep extended
  regex string as a first paramater, only containers mataching
  that regex will be cleaned up.
- e.g. tools/cleanup-containers "neutron|openvswitch"
  will cleanup all container whoes name contains either neutron
  or openvswitch.

Change-Id: Iadb68c0a8de40e9ec2c0a27568e3a372ec0e8303
Closes-Bug: #1522168

commit_message:
Add 'requires_beating' property to coordination driver

Certain functionality of drivers must be observed when
using a given driver (for example calling periodically
into the heartbeat method) by the user of a coordination
driver so to start with an important one explicitly
declare (and make introspectable the periodic_heartbeat
requirement that certain drivers demand to
operate correctly).

Change-Id: I999a6f8a9fa0bd4bb9ce16370cc38dac4043b085

commit_message:
Add support of new API URLs after port of extensions to core API

Make manilaclient support API URLs and actions rename after port of
extensions to core API.

Depends-on: I82f00114db985b4b3bf4db0a64191559508ac600

Implements bp ext-to-core

Change-Id: I44f71ca094f230f3c22ade241884a1b23865c81a

commit_message:
Add ability to deploy Murano CloudFoundry service broker API

Since Murano has new service CloudFoundry service broker API we need
to have an ability to deploy it using puppets

 - add new class for CloudFoundry service broker API called murano::cfapi
 - add tests for murano::cfapi class

Change-Id: I8e2993fabfe2cf59d982a0c58d0cfbc706a5309e
Co-Authored-By: Alexey Deryugin <aderyugin@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix dump for PostgreSQL is missing in a snapshot

This issue was introduced by
https://review.openstack.org/241271. Actually the changes in that
patch doesn't allow to execute a command (or file/dir operation) on a
local host.

This patch fixes:

* execution of a command on a local host (when neither address nor
hostname is specified)
* missing dump for PostgreSQL in a snapshot
* getting network address (address may be absent, but hostname could be
  present, so we need to use hostname in that case)

Change-Id: Iafecfa458372458963abd1e16890fe225454a612
Partial-bug: #1519303

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: I8706ac97bdaebd77d2bf889547f9a13a05d3ed98
Closes-Bug: #1368661

[{'created': '2015-12-03 09:32:12.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst'], 'message': 'add "unreleased" release notes page

We need a release notes page to show notes for unreleased versions by
scanning the "current" branch. This ensures that notes files cannot be
merged if they break the releasenotes job.

unreleased.rst file was missed in main commit:
I8ffe53af594150529c325814cf55812268193172
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ib324a69366437f3df6cfffabfde0c1a8d35c22eb
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
add "unreleased" release notes page

We need a release notes page to show notes for unreleased versions by
scanning the "current" branch. This ensures that notes files cannot be
merged if they break the releasenotes job.

unreleased.rst file was missed in main commit:
I8ffe53af594150529c325814cf55812268193172
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ib324a69366437f3df6cfffabfde0c1a8d35c22eb

Every time a new Ubuntu installation ISO image is released, the old ISO
image is removed and the labs scripts can no longer build new base disks
until ISO_URL and ISO_MD5 are updated.

With this patch, the labs scripts find and use the new Ubuntu ISO image

Change-Id: I41483f2c63a5cda36a5101e824d87e85b7de0161
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Auto-update ISO_URL

Every time a new Ubuntu installation ISO image is released, the old ISO
image is removed and the labs scripts can no longer build new base disks
until ISO_URL and ISO_MD5 are updated.

With this patch, the labs scripts find and use the new Ubuntu ISO image
if the old one is neither in the local IMG_DIR directory nor on the server.

Change-Id: I41483f2c63a5cda36a5101e824d87e85b7de0161

commit_message:
Add docstring for create/update methods([h-q]*)

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
we need to write docstring for http POST/PUT methods.
This patch adds docstring for create/update methods of compute client
[h-q]*. In addition, this patch fixes some inconsistencies like "Creates"
is changed to "Create".

Change-Id: I7c96053f0389b31b6321f0290a210a132862c90e

commit_message:
Add docstring for create/update methods([s-v]*)

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
we need to write docstring for http POST/PUT methods.
This patch adds docstring for create/update methods of compute client
[s-v]*. In addition, this patch fixes some inconsistencies like "Creates"
is changed to "Create".

Change-Id: I48917b6ddd40f1b959f2a1e1f2c6306524aeec99

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-17 16:39:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix Share status precedence based on instances

Currently Share status displayed is based on instance status
related to the given share. Current precedence is:

Available > Creating > Any other status.

But correct precedence should be:

Available > Any other status > Creating

This patch fixes precedence and adds unit tests to prevent it from
being broken again.

Closes-Bug: #1517124

commit_message:
Fix Share status precedence based on instances

Currently Share status displayed is based on instance status
related to the given share. Current precedence is:

Available > Creating > Any other status.

But correct precedence should be:

Available > Any other status > Transitional status

This patch fixes precedence and adds unit tests to prevent it from
being broken again.

Closes-Bug: #1517124
Change-Id: Ia0b16fa4c3ed3892242a727c524cfa89c9d2da19

branches, can create spurious errors.

Closes-Bug: #1368661
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-03 07:55:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Delete python bytecode before every test run

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: I1d35b586f678e8345b12654016f96a20c3c7bba3
Closes-Bug: #1368661

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 04:33:36.000000000', 'files': ['tools/run-layout.sh'], 'message': 'Pull latest changes in run-layout.sh

Some of my local tox tests were failing in odd ways; eventually I
chased it down to out-of-date versions of tools left in ".test"
directory.

This tries to pull the latest changes if the repos exist, and adds a
few helpful output points to let you know what's going on.

Change-Id: I30b7ddf84520e8895466a49ed6481812ea8875a8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Pull latest changes in run-layout.sh

Some of my local tox tests were failing in odd ways; eventually I
chased it down to out-of-date versions of tools left in ".test"
directory.

This tries to pull the latest changes if the repos exist, and adds a
few helpful output points to let you know what's going on.

Change-Id: I30b7ddf84520e8895466a49ed6481812ea8875a8

commit_message:
Makes policy.check aware of domain scoped token

This allows Domain Admin to also have a role on a Project(s).

Supersedes: 196068
Partially Implements: blueprint domain-scoped-tokens

Change-Id: Ia81e15a465117acf173c6459cec92838c825c460

commit_message:
Reorganize scheduler and merge code from Oslo incubator

With oslo-incubator going away, we need to pull those classes into
the Manila code base, along with their unit tests.  This presents a
good opportunity to do some long-needed housecleaning.  This commit
does the following:

1. Moves the scheduler classes from openstack.common to manila.
2. Adds the unit tests from olso-incubator into Manila.
3. Removes duplication among the combined scheduler modules.
4. Moves scheduler drivers into a sub-module.
5. Normalizes class and module naming throughout the scheduler.
6. Splits some unit test files so they match the names of the
   modules that they test.
7. Converts usage of mox & oslotest to mock & unittest.
8. Adds a few unit tests to boost coverage levels.

Implements: blueprint reorganize-manila-scheduler
Change-Id: I7aa237e17787e89a95bb198093ea9bc9498279cd

commit_message:
Add pcmk constraints against haproxy-clone only if applicable

When the Overcloud does not host an instance of haproxy, pcmk will
not have any resource named haproxy-clone so we should not add
any constraint relying on it.

Change-Id: I801f07b7570f3805aa71c22998fec6b6f192b350

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix default route in multiple nics net isolation templates

The non-controller nodes in the network/config/multiple-nics
directory do not have a default route configured. This change
adds the default route to the non-controller nodes using the
ControlPlaneDefaultRoute parameter, which was already a part
of these templates.

Change-Id: Idaaeb2a539555ac14cc613b202c428108bc19a30

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: Ia60baa319624e8ae5f833b6956323cf9e973d1b7
Closes-Bug: #1368661

commit_message:
grep check of "cinder type-list" should look for an exact match

thus avoiding the bug where a substring match could lead to a false
positive.

To start translation, we need to initially import the translation
file - and place it at the proper place so that the usual CI
scripts can handle it. The proper place is for all python
projects $PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg.

Further imports will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot.

Change-Id: I6c5c8944d357b82f47d763da7c6933356aaaced7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Setup for translation

To start translation, we need to initially import the translation
file - and place it at the proper place so that the usual CI
scripts can handle it. The proper place is for all python
projects $PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg.

Further imports will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot.

Change-Id: I6c5c8944d357b82f47d763da7c6933356aaaced7

commit_message:
Add test with nodegroup removal after cluster reset

Create test which removes nodegroup from new environment
and checks its nodes are marked as 'error'.
Also change 'assign_nodegroup' method to use PUT request
to '/api/nodes/' URL for assigning nodes to nodegroup,
because old handler was removed from Nailgun here:
I88b7d4c550f87fe9620467f4c3212a7034c89999.

Change-Id: Iae0abac3af1d126facf2045763c4fe1b1b9e940e
Related-bug: #1521682

subject: Add option to skip snapshot cycles
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-29 07:25:42.000000000', 'files': ['labs/osbash/osbash.sh', 'labs/osbash/scripts/osbash/init_xxx_node.sh', 'labs/osbash/lib/osbash/functions-host.sh'], 'message': 'Add option to skip snapshot cycles

This patch adds a new option for ignoring the snapshot_cycle command.
Instead of shutting down the machine, taking a snapshot and rebooting it
again, the next script in the list is immediately executed. Only
snapshots created with the snapshot_cycle command are affected.

This speeds up the build time for the cluster considerably.

The patch also starts the network interfaces in init_xxx_node to have
them ready for the next script without having to reboot the machine.

Change-Id: I12a11144113a1fcde60a64a525e2217f4a758577
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add option to skip snapshot cycles

This patch adds a new option for ignoring the snapshot_cycle command.
Instead of shutting down the machine, taking a snapshot and rebooting it
again, the next script in the list is immediately executed. Only
snapshots created with the snapshot_cycle command are affected.

This speeds up the build time for the cluster considerably.

The patch also starts the network interfaces in init_xxx_node to have
them ready for the next script without having to reboot the machine.

Change-Id: I12a11144113a1fcde60a64a525e2217f4a758577

commit_message:
Fix help for image-create

The help for image-create states that --file 'Must be present if images
are not passed to the client via stdin.'

However, doing image-create without --file is a valid operation - it
queues a file to be created.

Change-Id: I8167c6a891fa2540c84e3b888031d90a34a9b5fc

commit_message:
Change not found HTTP status code from 400 to 404

Provide more accurate status for client or other request end. For example,
cloudkittyclient deal with HTTPNotFound status specially.

Change-Id: I14f02b4de68e3ecc72dd80e2af09ec572c8c5f9b

commit_message:
Enable signature verification for events

Currently, the events and samples are signed before publishing, but only
samples signature will be verified when recording to database, this change
add the signature verfication of events.

Change-Id: I1b3e7f8873332ec51c0cc0534077eb508c411e1c
Closes-Bug: #1501140

commit_message:
Top Nav shouldn't include giant bottom margin

In the 'default' and 'material' themes, we remove the default bootstrap
margin on the top navbar because it creates a gap between the sidenav
and the topnav. This should be a global style so that other themes can
take advantage of it. It looks best with a single 1px value on
alternate themes.

Change-Id: Ie0f3e5e22c29fe737d128af6d2fd6499fe9ee99a
Closes-Bug: #1518455

subject: Avoid warning when time taken is close to zero
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 00:53:25.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_service/loopingcall.py'], 'message': 'Avoid warning when time taken is close to zero

We use "%(delay).2f" to print the time taken so even
if the delay is say 0.001, we will still print the
warning. We should just round it off till the 2nd place
to avoid odd looking lines that say:

run outlasted interval by 0.00 sec

Change-Id: I7137eb7ad985d7f35adc62a65ad1218a39a7a959
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid warning when time taken is close to zero

We use "%(delay).2f" to print the time taken so even
if the delay is say 0.001, we will still print the
warning. We should just round it off till the 2nd place
to avoid odd looking lines that say:

run outlasted interval by 0.00 sec

Change-Id: I7137eb7ad985d7f35adc62a65ad1218a39a7a959

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-19 18:37:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Hyper-V: adds os-win library

Adds os-win to requirements.txt.
Replaces the current usage of *Utils classes in the
Hyper-V Driver with the equivalent *Utils classes
from os-win.

Adds decorators to the HyperVDriver methods that prevent
os-win specific exceptions to leak outside the driver.

Depends-On: Id5cd1dce195b38611f4f8c74857087620048b13f

commit_message:
Hyper-V: adds os-win library

Adds os-win to requirements.txt.
Replaces the current usage of *Utils classes in the
Hyper-V Driver with the equivalent *Utils classes
from os-win.

Adds decorators to the HyperVDriver methods that prevent
os-win specific exceptions to leak outside the driver.

Depends-On: Id5cd1dce195b38611f4f8c74857087620048b13f

Co-Authored-By: Lucian Petrut <lpetrut@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint add-os-win-library

Change-Id: I04509843210dcedf98a0cd9e08fa07865c8a76de

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 16:11:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP]Added ceilometer-polling upstart jobs

The ceilometer-central-agent and ceilometer-agent-compute
services are now completely removed from the liberty release
of ceilometer. The new implementation is to use ceilometer-polling
and call the respective pollsters by namespace.
This patch addes the neccessary upstart configurations for
ceilometer-polling and it also removes the deprecated admin_* options
from the ceilometer config file.

Change-Id: Iba2bb148df4f3ae9d16b44c27ddff0c0d3fd29d3
Closes-Bug: #1519423
Closes-Bug: #1519462
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-25 17:40:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Added ceilometer-polling upstart jobs

The ceilometer-central-agent and ceilometer-agent-compute
services are now completely removed from the liberty release
of ceilometer. The new implementation is to use ceilometer-polling
and call the respective pollsters by namespace.
This patch addes the neccessary upstart configurations for

commit_message:
Added ceilometer-polling upstart jobs

The ceilometer-central-agent and ceilometer-agent-compute
services are now completely removed from the liberty release
of ceilometer. The new implementation is to use ceilometer-polling
and call the respective pollsters by namespace.
This patch addes the neccessary upstart configurations for
ceilometer-polling and it also removes the deprecated admin_* options
from the ceilometer config file.
This patch set is also forcing ceilometer to use the Keystone
v2.0 API by adding the versioned path uder [service_credentials]
in the ceilometer config file.

Change-Id: Iba2bb148df4f3ae9d16b44c27ddff0c0d3fd29d3
UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1519423
Closes-Bug: #1519462

commit_message:
Send DB updates to Queue

Instead of calling the DB driver with the controller context
and waiting for DB changes, the controller pass async callback
to the DB driver, this callback sends new updates to a priority
queue.
The controller start listen on this queue and process updates.
The DB driver is now in charge of creating any listener threads
needed to retrieve the updates.

Change-Id: Ic9ba561451743300730f0f2361d29a4d89146e87

commit_message:
Setup for translation

To start translation, we need to initially import the translation
file - and place it at the proper place so that the usual CI
scripts can handle it. The proper place is for all python
projects $PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot - see setup.cfg.

Further imports will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot.

Change-Id: If3a739f376b063351434bc3a5169bf9a95a5d2aa

commit_message:
Remove unused logging module import

Currently, in some file we import logging module from oslo, but we had't
use it by far.

This patch remove them, and we can add it as we needs in future.

Change-Id: I8a803105c3ed26cf4e5e96d26ede24fd5eaaef9f

commit_message:
Add flag for test_incremental_backup

Forced creation of incremental backup is not
implemented in old release (Juno and Kilo).
The test is skipped by default for Juno and Kilo gates.
Need to add flag to unskip this test in new release.

New test: Idde2c14aba78382b1063ce20269f4832f9fdd583
Change-Id: I565b5941d6067644fc9ca6cb0891d97f4946e031
Partial-Bug: #1506394
(cherry picked from commit a366b97c0a76304bf0ddf7eb78e0efb4493df221)

commit_message:
Use inspect.getcallargs directly

We drop Python 2.6 support recently, we can use inspect.getcallargs
in Python 2.7+, please refer to:
https://docs.python.org/2/library/inspect.html#inspect.getcallargs

Change-Id: I166bf47fa652cb9eb112c30d90624017cb723198

commit_message:
Make migration_type not nullable in db.

There are 4 types of migrations in nova. Migration.migration_type
should not be null. A 'nullable' argument is set to False when it
is defined. But in db related files, 'nullable' is set to True.

This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ieafa1ffb6a678974a4545562708b24ee3660114a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 15:51:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add the Docker container format

A Docker image is a tar archive typically containing a container
filesystem. In order to use the nova-docker compute driver nova and boot
docker instances glance support of the docker container format is
required.

This patch adds the Docker container format to the Glance configuration.

Change-Id: Ifa206686086232a5599e7bc27a852bc5f3186ebc
Closes-Bug: #1519402
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-24 17:03:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add the Docker container format

A Docker image is a tar archive typically containing a container
filesystem. In order to use the nova-docker compute driver nova and boot
docker instances glance support of the docker container format is
required.

This patch adds the Docker container format to the Glance configuration.

DocImpact: Docs will need to be updated to indicate that the docker
container_format is now one of the default container formats supported
by Glance.

Closes-Bug: #1519402
Change-Id: Ifa206686086232a5599e7bc27a852bc5f3186ebc
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-12-01 16:47:00.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/config.py', 'glance/contrib/plugins/image_artifact/v1/image.py', 'etc/glance-api.conf', 'doc/source/glanceapi.rst', 'rally-jobs/plugins/plugin_sample.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py', 'doc/source/formats.rst'], 'message': "Add the Docker container format

A Docker image is a tar archive typically containing a container
filesystem. In order to use the nova-docker compute driver nova and boot
docker instances glance support of the docker container format is
required.

This patch adds the Docker container format to the Glance configuration.

DocImpact: Docs will need to be updated to indicate that the docker
container_format is now one of the default container formats supported
by Glance.

UpgradeImpact: Adds 'docker' to the default list of container_formats.
Operators will no longer need to configure specifically to use docker
containers.

Closes-Bug: #1519402
Change-Id: Ifa206686086232a5599e7bc27a852bc5f3186ebc

commit_message:
Add the Docker container format

A Docker image is a tar archive typically containing a container
filesystem. In order to use the nova-docker compute driver nova and boot
docker instances glance support of the docker container format is
required.

This patch adds the Docker container format to the Glance configuration.

DocImpact: Docs will need to be updated to indicate that the docker
container_format is now one of the default container formats supported
by Glance.

UpgradeImpact: Adds 'docker' to the default list of container_formats.
Operators will no longer need to configure specifically to use docker
containers.

Closes-Bug: #1519402
Change-Id: Ifa206686086232a5599e7bc27a852bc5f3186ebc

commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: Ie1de30cab00d81fc6712e554cbd3b28db29213cd
Closes-Bug: #1520036

commit_message:
Remove db and object usage in cli.commands.task module

In order to make Rally as a Service, rally CLI modules do
not allow to work with rally.common.db and rally.common.objects.

This patch remove rally.common.db and rally.common.objects
usage in cli.commands.task moudle, and make necessary change
on unit tests.

Change-Id: I5be1c52d1723e5f85d78e8386fadff98bdfedb6f

commit_message:
Adds comments and small fixes

Fixes in this patch:
1) Set time_timit=0.25 for process_data_events in poll
   It is needed to release lock time to time and give
   a chance another method to be executed
2) move declare_queue_bindind method from pika_engine
   to impl_pika module because it is not common and used
   only there
3) small optimization - now unregister_reply_waiter
   is called in worst case only - if we have not got
   reply by timeout expiration

Change-Id: I18b6cdec9c1f746086a5a1ae4ecd8d8ecdaa9468

commit_message:
Move i18n to _i18n, as per oslo_i18n guidelines

- This does NOT break other projects that rely on neutron.i18n,
  as this change includes a debtcollector shim to maintain those
  older entry points, until they can migrate.
- Also updates _i18n.py to the latest pattern defined by oslo_i18n
- Guidance and template are from the reference:
  http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html

Partially-Closes-Bug: #1519493
Change-Id: I1aa3a5fd837d9156da4643a367013c869ed8bf9d

commit_message:
Init Patch for Stateless Architecture

Init patch for stateless architecture. API, db and client modules
are borrowed from master branch, but dispatcher and proxy modules
are removed. Also adapt OpenStack new project template.

Change-Id: I9f84cb029195cf26e9ad71ae3cbd69b2cc765bb2

commit_message:
Give unique name to all resources created in functional test

Duplicated name of resources created in different test cases could
cause some issues when tests are running in parallel. This patch
gives unique name to all resources created in functional test
to avoid this issue.

Change-Id: I585a8f3ff47aa32310a712fe00f74af587a1aa54

commit_message:
Add spec for online-schema-upgrades

This commit adds spec explaining how to implement DB schema upgrades
in a live way to achieve ability to do rolling (or non-downtime)
upgrades of Cinder.

Change-Id: I19b1128335cc26fbf3287710a4cb974f695c89ba
Implements: bp online-schema-upgrades

commit_message:
Make volume_quotas_client  use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes aggregates_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I58334c3dd6b740129a2d80d2a6dfa61b4548ae08

commit_message:
updating with other reno changes

We need a release notes page to show notes for unreleased versions by
scanning the "current" branch. This ensures that notes files cannot be
merged if they break the releasenotes job.

also running job to treat warnings as errors.

Change-Id: I14a993f2830d3c0f9fd8d1bec7b2b71b315a13d2

subject: Add host_name information into nova driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-18 20:23:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add host_name and hypervisor_hostname information into nova driver

The user specifies a policy for both server and host and their
hierarchical relationship. In the current nova driver, there is no
mapping information between them.

commit_message:
Add host_name information into nova driver

The user specifies a policy for both server and host and their
hierarchical relationship. In the current nova driver, there is no
mapping information between them. The implemented host_name is
a host name of hypervisor which VM is running.

Closes-Bug: #1515576

Change-Id: Ib05685f9449c46f069a2d2dffce9af558107846b

commit_message:
Replacing application_catalog with application-catalog

Murano has changed its type, due to the bug that prevented correct
keystone communication in certain cases.

Change-Id: I72e0cf6834e98925eb9ddca57db8f57f10f66da0
Closes-bug: #1514692
Depends-On: Id568c0a59b2e99dc946b1f2f55f6b233fd6a1b27

commit_message:
Adds availability zones to nova datasource driver

The current nova provides availability zones but nova data source
driver does not support it. In order to give more flexible and
extensible usage, we need to add it to nova driver.

Change-Id: I6f34216b4a47a0e58973fc8a5ef6072923077603

commit_message:
Push Type Datasource Driver

Currently, Congress only has datasource drivers which polls data
from cloud service. This spec proposes a push type datasource driver
which receives data from cloud service.

blueprint push-type-datasource-driver

Change-Id: Ie8e76547ff0f9f67e0aeb05b36ee1b66e8b4cb61

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 03:53:38.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: Ib2af15b06f75b86edd4d7f7ca37695b85b12b311
Closes-Bug: #1368661
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Delete python bytecode before every test run

Because python creates pyc files during tox runs, certain
changes in the tree, like deletes of files, or switching
branches, can create spurious errors.

Change-Id: Ib2af15b06f75b86edd4d7f7ca37695b85b12b311
Closes-Bug: #1368661

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-31 22:19:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add a 'choices' option to the Integer type class

Add a 'choices' option to the Integer type class. This is similar to the
'choices' option in the String type class.

The 'choices' option can be a list/tuple/set of allowed values. If a
value is set which is not one of the allowed values a ValueError
exception is raised.

Add corresponding unit tests for the 'choices' option.

Change-Id: I3189e1ee59af72c29bad8bbb140e9255927d872b

Also fixed test case that was using 'baar' and 'baaar' as two different

commit_message:
Add IntegerChoices and IntChoicesOpt classes

Added an IntegerChoices class which stores an integer and allows
specifying a list of valid choices that can be specified.

Added an IntChoicesOpt class which uses IntegerChoices

Also fixed test case that was using 'baar' and 'baaar' as two different
values to compare, which was hard for readability.

Change-Id: I3189e1ee59af72c29bad8bbb140e9255927d872b

commit_message:
Add documentation for HA ceilometer

HA ceilometer can work if the proper overrides
are configured. This patch adds documentation
regarding running ceilometer in an active/active
HA configuration, meaning workload paritioning
can be done across multiple polling agents and
notification agents.

Change-Id: I65402a66f465df8dc82a24460531fba3a24a8cf5
Closes-Bug: #1518005
(cherry picked from commit 5371a0eb93ff088e8f26fef698ff7fcae95a58fa)

commit_message:
Use PyPi packages for ceph python bindings

Ceph python bindings are now available from pypi, so they can be
installed within a venv. Previously we were relying on the bindings
being installed via an apt package and symlinking out of the relevant
venvs into site packages.

This commit also includes a revert for the commit that introduced the
symlinks:

Revert "Symlink ceph libraries out of venv"

This reverts commit a0ab6f7a6efea1dabf5ac006f766c17596a0d10b.

Ceph Bug: http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/5900
Related-Bug: #1509837
Package URL: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-cephlibs/0.94.5.post1

Change-Id: Id8a0b8ea810fd9e43f9743bb2572e2b6b0985230

commit_message:
Decoupling magnum service from periodic task

Liberty tech-debt-bug

Magnum service was initially utilizing periodic task within magnum
conductor. This commit lays out independent periodic framework for
magnum service, by decoupling from periodic task.

Change-Id: Ie0e725b75069309a9fa783f77c1a454f9dae549e
Partial-Bug: 1500998

commit_message:
Remove py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: Ia00d0c10d8694e331eb0690933268b952e0565dd
Closes-Bug: 1519510
Depends-On: Id93b7af9cc3ed548b78e9b08528e18e9c0383c7a

commit_message:
Change DIB role to default to Debian jessie

In the event that Debian is selected or defaulted to for an image
build operation, then that image should be jessie based.

Added logic to check and set if so, and permit user override.

Change-Id: I2c54cd4ec11fe85c246c25c3bcc219a22ef26b12

commit_message:
Removed old (and unused) openstack/oslo libs

Since all oslo libs are now using the new versions installed using
pip, there is no need to keep the watcher/openstack/common/ folder.

Implements: blueprint make-watcher-use-graduated-oslo-lib
Change-Id: I9e08b4a50c6b15a4d51a7f53fdd615d6c28fdce7

Added unit tests to recon.py.

Added tests for unrecognized recon_types for get_replication_info,
get_updater_info, and get_auditor_info.

Added tests for get_device_info and get_swift_conf_md5.

PEP8 compliance fixes.

Updates based on code reviews.

commit_message:
Add Backup & Restore feature for CouchDB database

Even though Trove supports backup and restore capabilities, this
feature hasnt been implemented for CouchDB. This spec provides
details regarding how to do backups and restore operation for
CouchDB.

Change-Id: Ie70a353d264bf2f0436deeb76200c5cf5977151d
Implements: blueprint couchdb-backup-restore

commit_message:
Removing SQL Schema Downgrade

Following a cross-project spec [1] we are supposed to remove
downgrade methods from migration files.

Change-Id: I9979a23d412e33856ca214b1807d8659f136ef88
Related: blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/remove-sql-schema-downgrades

commit_message:
Wake up AMT interface before send request

AMT interface goes to sleep after a period of time if the host
is off. Add a new method 'awake_amt_interface' for amt driver
to awake nodes' AMT interface.
This method will ping AMT interface to to wake it up before sending
request. Also set 60s by default as cache time.

Change-Id: I4d81001c01e7908100a6571b366cb296253f2fc1
Close-bug: #1504023

commit_message:
Fix No module named importlib in python-*client

keystoneclient use importlib, and the gate failed to import it in
python2.6 env. Cause gate error with *No module named importlib*.

Change-Id: Idec51aed154ef18f14be99e7a63a575468d07964

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-14 17:34:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add flavor option to loadbalancerv2 creation

Builds on the Neutron services flavor framework in the referenced
Depends-On change id.

This solution uses a flavor of service type LOADBALANCERV2
associated with a flavor profile containing a driver.  If a
flavor_id is passed during loadbalancerv2 creation, the flavor is
used to find the provider for the driver and populate
the existing lbaas provider field.

This allows a user to specify a flavor like 'Gold' with the
operator dynamically controlling which provider is associated
with that flavor for subsequent creates.

The flavor_id is persisted in the DB with a foreign key reference
to the flavors.id, and for this solution the selected provider
controls subsequent control operations against the created
loadbalancer.

To enable multiple providers in DevStack, enhanced the plugin.sh
and settings to add a secondary service provider.

Change-Id: Ic3b459692d092658df93d4c855079311d9bc7ace
Depends-On: I5c22ab655a8e2a2e586c10eae9de9b72db49755f
Implements: blueprint neutron-flavor-framework
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-01 14:43:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add flavor option to loadbalancerv2 creation

This allows a user to specify a flavor like 'Gold' with the
operator dynamically controlling which provider is associated
with that flavor for subsequent creates.

The flavor_id is persisted in the DB with a foreign key reference
to the flavors.id, and for this solution the selected provider

To enable multiple providers in DevStack for testing as defaults

commit_message:
Add flavor option to loadbalancerv2 creation

Builds on the Neutron services flavor framework in the referenced
Depends-On change id.

This solution uses a flavor of service type LOADBALANCERV2
associated with a flavor profile containing a driver.  If a
flavor_id is passed during loadbalancerv2 creation, the flavor is
used to find the provider for the driver and populate
the existing lbaas provider field.

This allows a user to specify a flavor like 'Gold' with the
operator dynamically controlling which provider is associated
with that flavor for subsequent creates.

The flavor_id is persisted in the DB.  The selected provider
controls subsequent control operations against the created
loadbalancer.

Also ensure everything works gracefully if flavors plugin is not loaded.

Adding api and doc impact tags as the new optional flavor_id parameter
should be described to consumers.

Co-Authored-By: James Arendt <james.arendt@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Madhusudhan Kandadai <madhusudhan.kandadai@hpe.com>

ApiImpact
DocImpact
Change-Id: Ic3b459692d092658df93d4c855079311d9bc7ace
Depends-On: I5c22ab655a8e2a2e586c10eae9de9b72db49755f
Partially implements: blueprint neutron-flavor-framework

This patch fixes the Ceilometer Debian install, by adding Debian
to a few conditionals, and removing some parts which aren't needed
in Debian.

commit_message:
Enable all extension for image API sample tests

As extensions options has been deprecated, API sample tests
should run against all extension enable.

This commit enables all extensions for Image API tests and remove its specific
extensions tests and sample files.
Also adds some basic hack to merge all APIs tests for all extension.

Partially implements blueprint api-sample-tests-with-all-extensions

Change-Id: Ib603fbccfdc09b25d4c69c872d79e4cafc30fff5

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4240, 'name': 'Craig Vyvial', 'email': 'cp16net@gmail.com', 'username': 'cp16net'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 10440, 'name': 'Alex Tomic', 'email': 'atomic777@gmail.com', 'username': 'atomic77'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}, {'_account_id': 15321, 'name': 'Matthew Van Dijk', 'email': 'mvandijk@tesora.com', 'username': 'mvandijk'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-19 18:58:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add better input checking for MongoDB

A user-create on the Trove admin user "admin.os_admin" can change the
password of that user, rendering the guest agent useless (the password
it tries to use no longer being valid).

A user-create can also be used to change the password of existing users.

The guest does no validation of inputs for various user-* commands.

None of the above should be allowed.

The fix is to skip any names on the ignored user's list and add more
checking for existing users in codepaths.

Tests are also updated as needed.

Change-Id: Icae98f57f7beda23e52b7e59a1a386c03ff20cf8
Closes-bug: 1517622
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-20 19:04:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add better input checking for MongoDB

A user-create on the Trove admin user "admin.os_admin" can change the
password of that user, rendering the guest agent useless (the password
it tries to use no longer being valid).

A user-create can also be used to change the password of existing users.

The guest does no validation of inputs for various user-* commands.

None of the above should be allowed.

The fix is to skip any names on the ignored user's list and add more
checking for existing users in codepaths.

Tests are also updated as needed.

commit_message:
Add better input checking for MongoDB

A user-create on the Trove admin user "admin.os_admin" can change the
password of that user, rendering the guest agent useless (the password
it tries to use no longer being valid).

A user-create can also be used to change the password of existing users.

The guest does no validation of inputs for various user-* commands.

None of the above should be allowed.

The fix is to skip any names on the ignored user's list and add more
checking for existing users in codepaths.

Tests are also updated as needed.

Change-Id: Icae98f57f7beda23e52b7e59a1a386c03ff20cf8
Closes-bug: 1517622

subject: [Verify] Fixing issue with create_isolated_networks = False
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-01 14:57:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[Verify] Fixing issue with create_isolated_networks = False

If you take a look at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229623/ and the
corresponding test run [1], you will see that 70 tempest tests failed.
It is because the create_isolated_networks flag is set to False. The
wrong option value was introduced by the following patch [2]. We don't
need to set the value for the option because we have the corresponding
Tempest context that uses the following logic:

    if the cloud doesn't have any shared networks, the default behavior
    defined in Tempest will be used and Tempest itself will manage network
    resources, i.e Tempest will create networks, subnets, routers, etc;

    if the cloud has some shared networks, we will create our own shared
    network and specify its name in the Tempest config file to avoid the
    "Multiple possible networks found." error;

    if user configures the fixed_network_name option in the tempest.conf
    file manually, then we don't need to do anything.

So we should remove create_isolated_networks = False from the config.ini
file to fix the issue.

Also we should use use_dynamic_credentials = True instead of allow_tenant_
isolation = True because this option is deprecated [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229623/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/23/229623/3/gate/gate-rally-dsvm-verify-full/3921e9c/rally-verify/7_verify_results_--html.html.gz
[3] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/config.py#L63

commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing issue with create_isolated_networks = False

If you take a look at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229623/ and the
corresponding test run [1], you will see that 70 tempest tests failed.
It is because the create_isolated_networks flag is set to False. The
wrong option value was introduced by the mentioned patch. We don't
need to set the value for the option because we have the corresponding
Tempest context that uses the following logic:

    if the cloud doesn't have any shared networks, the default behavior
    defined in Tempest will be used and Tempest itself will manage network
    resources, i.e Tempest will create networks, subnets, routers, etc;

    if the cloud has some shared networks, we will create our own shared
    network and specify its name in the Tempest config file to avoid the
    "Multiple possible networks found." error;

    if user configures the fixed_network_name option in the tempest.conf
    file manually, then we don't need to do anything.

So we should remove create_isolated_networks = False from the config.ini
file to fix the issue.

Also we should use use_dynamic_credentials = True instead of allow_tenant_
isolation = True because this option is deprecated [2].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/23/229623/3/gate/gate-rally-dsvm-verify-full/3921e9c/rally-verify/7_verify_results_--html.html.gz
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/config.py#L63

Change-Id: I4fe74bf6b4f12fc09ba94f3bef68c304630a848f

commit_message:
Reorganize documentation

This patch reorgs the documentation structure. After this reorg, the top
level structure becomes:

  - overview
  - install
  - getting started
  - contributing to Senlin
  - glossary
  - man pages

Change-Id: I21ad4375e7c7baef46cbb2a51f7f38f40e275742

commit_message:
Make asynchronous action return 202

In senlin the actions are executed asynchronously, according to
api-wg, asynchronous action should return 202 instead of 200
status code to client to confirm the request.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Idd9e139844073c3dfa79990a9426ae2973367627
Implements: blueprint http-response-modification

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 21:33:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add reno for release notes management

This cycle, to address these problems for our ever-growing set of
projects, the release management team is introducing a new tool for
handling release notes as files in-tree, to allow us to simply and
continuously build the release notes for stable branch point releases
and milestones on the master branch. The idea is to use small YAML
files, usually one per note or patch, to avoid merge conflicts on
backports and then to compile those files in a deterministic way
into a more readable document for readers. Files containing release
notes can be including in patches directly, or you can create a
separate patch with release notes if you want to document a feature
than spans several patches.  The tool is called Reno, and it currently
supports ReStructuredText and Sphinx for converting note input files
to HTML for publication.  Reno is git branch-aware, so we can have
separate release notes documents for each release series published
together from the master build.

-- Excerpted from Doug Hellmann's email to the mailing list
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f

commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

This cycle, to address these problems for our ever-growing set of
projects, the release management team is introducing a new tool for
handling release notes as files in-tree, to allow us to simply and
continuously build the release notes for stable branch point releases
and milestones on the master branch. The idea is to use small YAML
files, usually one per note or patch, to avoid merge conflicts on
backports and then to compile those files in a deterministic way
into a more readable document for readers. Files containing release
notes can be including in patches directly, or you can create a
separate patch with release notes if you want to document a feature
than spans several patches.  The tool is called Reno, and it currently
supports ReStructuredText and Sphinx for converting note input files
to HTML for publication.  Reno is git branch-aware, so we can have
separate release notes documents for each release series published
together from the master build.

-- Excerpted from Doug Hellmann's email to the mailing list
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

For more information about Reno:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/

Change-Id: I4028d52f5e67d2873b3dc9df279f78a15c35d84f

subject: Fix fixed_ip schema and service client
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 02:48:12.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/api_schema/response/compute/v2_1/fixed_ips.py', 'tempest_lib/tests/services/compute/test_fixedIPs_client.py', 'tempest_lib/services/compute/fixed_ips_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix fixed_ip schema and service client

There are two issues in fixed_ip schema and client.
1. Schema expect string in response body-
   Nova had bug#1356058 for response of reserve/unreserve fixed ip APIs,
   where plain text ("202 Accepted The request is accepted for processing.")
   was returned in response body.
   It is fixed on Nova side - Ifca3081f573407808a2196e71ac1db87180db6ec

2. Return value of reserve_fixed_ip client method-
    In Fixed ip service client, reserve_fixed_ip method does not
    return the response body.
    As per consistency in service client interfaces, this method should
    return the response value even that is empty body.

Those were fixed in Tempest but did not get sync in lib.
-I098ee0d1fa3056f8cfb0654e2b8fd3bf75fb3e2c
-I2cb1ef8dacd1994576656cfb108dd2eef2fbd988

Change-Id: I27b8d2165188ee069f5d8d22c0426f2c748f80c8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix fixed_ip schema and service client

There are two issues in fixed_ip schema and client.
1. Schema expect string in response body-
   Nova had bug#1356058 for response of reserve/unreserve fixed ip APIs,
   where plain text ("202 Accepted The request is accepted for processing.")
   was returned in response body.
   It is fixed on Nova side - Ifca3081f573407808a2196e71ac1db87180db6ec

2. Return value of reserve_fixed_ip client method-
    In Fixed ip service client, reserve_fixed_ip method does not
    return the response body.
    As per consistency in service client interfaces, this method should
    return the response value even that is empty body.

Those were fixed in Tempest but did not get sync in lib.
-I098ee0d1fa3056f8cfb0654e2b8fd3bf75fb3e2c
-I2cb1ef8dacd1994576656cfb108dd2eef2fbd988

Change-Id: I27b8d2165188ee069f5d8d22c0426f2c748f80c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-05 15:37:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMware: add in vnic resource limitations

The flavor extra specs for quotas has been extended to support
 quota:vnic_limit - The bandwidth limit for the virtual network adapter.
                    The utilization of the virtual network adapter will not
                    exceed this limit, even if there are available resources.
                    Units in Mbits/sec.
 quota:vnic_reservation - Amount of network bandwidth that is guaranteed to
                          the virtual network adapter. If utilization is less
                          than reservation, the resource can be used by other
                          virtual network adapters. Reservation is not allowed
                          to exceed the value of limit if limit is set.
                          Units in Mbits/sec.

Shares: Network share. The value is used as a relative weight in competing for
        shared bandwidth, in case of resource contention.

 quota:vnic_shares_level - the allocation level. This can be 'custom', 'high'
                          'normal' or 'low'.
 quota:vnic_shares_share - in the event that 'custom' is used, this is the
                          number of shares.

This enables the VMware driver to enable VNIC allocations
for the running instance.

WIP - still need to add unit tests

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id321ffcb17114b53141f2489156869d418b768fd
