", 'number': 16}, {'created': '2015-07-20 13:54:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMware: add in vnic resource limitations

The flavor extra specs for quotas has been extended to support
 quota:vif_limit - The bandwidth limit for the virtual network adapter.
                   The utilization of the virtual network adapter will not
                   exceed this limit, even if there are available resources.
                   Units in Mbits/sec.
 quota:vif_reservation - Amount of network bandwidth that is guaranteed to
                         the virtual network adapter. If utilization is less
                         than reservation, the resource can be used by other
                         virtual network adapters. Reservation is not allowed
                         to exceed the value of limit if limit is set.
                         Units in Mbits/sec.

Shares: Network share. The value is used as a relative weight in competing for
        shared bandwidth, in case of resource contention.

 quota:vif_shares_level - the allocation level. This can be 'custom', 'high'
                          'normal' or 'low'.
 quota:vif_shares_share - in the event that 'custom' is used, this is the
                          number of shares.

Please see http://goo.gl/c2amhq for a detailed explanation of the above.

This enables the VMware driver to enable VNIC allocations
for the running instance.

Co-Authored-By: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>
DocImpact

This is part of the blueprint vmware-limits

commit_message:
VMware: add in vif resource limitations

The flavor extra specs for quotas has been extended to support
 quota:vif_limit - The bandwidth limit for the virtual network adapter.
                   The utilization of the virtual network adapter will not
                   exceed this limit, even if there are available resources.
                   Units in Mbits/sec.
 quota:vif_reservation - Amount of network bandwidth that is guaranteed to
                         the virtual network adapter. If utilization is less
                         than reservation, the resource can be used by other
                         virtual network adapters. Reservation is not allowed
                         to exceed the value of limit if limit is set.
                         Units in Mbits/sec.

Shares: Network share. The value is used as a relative weight in competing for
        shared bandwidth, in case of resource contention.

 quota:vif_shares_level - the allocation level. This can be 'custom', 'high'
                          'normal' or 'low'.
 quota:vif_shares_share - in the event that 'custom' is used, this is the
                             number of shares.

Please see http://goo.gl/c2amhq for a detailed explanation of the above.

This enables the VMware driver to enable VNIC allocations
for the running instance.

NOTE: this is only supported from vCenter 6.0 onwards.

Co-Authored-By: Radoslav Gerganov <rgerganov@vmware.com>
DocImpact

This is part of the blueprint vmware-limits-mitaka

Change-Id: Id321ffcb17114b53141f2489156869d418b768fd

Optimize "open" method with context manager

Use opening context manager to open a file.

commit_message:
add hacking check for config options location

This adds a hackign check which raises a pep8 error if a config
option was found in location where it shouldn't be.

Change-Id: I75df3404cc6178aa179e96d75f154e389c3008af

[{'created': '2015-10-06 11:28:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Replace "Terminate Instance" with "Delete Instance"

"Delete" is being used almost everywhere in OpenStack Dashboard
except the instance panel. Using "Delete" looks more consistent.
In addition, "Delete" tells non-native English speakers that
deleted instances will be no longer usable again compared to
"Terminate".

I am proposing this patch for discussion.
Note that it does not touch "Delete (volume) on terminate"
and "Trove" dashabord. Once we have a consensus, I would like
to cleanup them.

Change-Id: Idccaf3c45566f20f11d02ada64c1d3934a6f3002

commit_message:
Replace "Terminate Instance" with "Delete Instance"

"Delete" is being used almost everywhere in OpenStack Dashboard
except the instance panel. Using "Delete" looks more consistent.
In addition, "Delete" tells non-native English speakers that
deleted instances will be no longer usable again compared to
"Terminate".

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1502773
Change-Id: Idccaf3c45566f20f11d02ada64c1d3934a6f3002

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-10-10 06:15:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cleanup of compute api reboot method

The interaction of between the check_instance_state decorator for
the compute api reboot method and the extra checking done within
the method for task states was confusing and in some cases
contradictory. For example although the decorator allowed
instances with a task_state of REBOOTING_HARD, in practice it
could never succed whether it was a soft or hard reboot.

Also several task states allowed by the decorator were implicitly
rejected because they were not listed in the expected task_states for
the instance save call. This too is fixed.

Change-Id: Iba24f2ed9d2d3161318b4b1fc55c0e97d7aed1c6
Closes-Bug: 1379425
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-10-15 23:47:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Cleanup of compute api reboot method

The interaction between the check_instance_state decorator for
the compute api reboot method and the extra checking done within
the method for task states was confusing and in some cases
contradictory. For example although the decorator allowed
instances with a task_state of REBOOTING_HARD, in practice it
could never succeed whether it was a soft or hard reboot.

Also several task states allowed by the decorator were implicitly
rejected because they were not listed in the expected task_states for
the instance save call. This too is fixed.

Change-Id: Iba24f2ed9d2d3161318b4b1fc55c0e97d7aed1c6
Closes-Bug: 1379425

contradictory. For example although the decorator allowed
instances with a task_state of REBOOTING_HARD, in practice it
could never succeed whether it was a soft or hard reboot.

Also several task states allowed by the decorator were implicitly
rejected because they were not listed in the expected task_states for
the instance save call. This too is fixed.

Change-Id: Iba24f2ed9d2d3161318b4b1fc55c0e97d7aed1c6
Closes-Bug: 1379425

commit_message:
Cleanup of compute api reboot method

The interaction between the check_instance_state decorator for
the compute api reboot method and the extra checking done within
the method for task states was confusing and in some cases
contradictory.

Also several task states allowed by the decorator were implicitly
rejected because they were not listed in the expected task_states for
the instance save call. This too is fixed.

Change-Id: Iba24f2ed9d2d3161318b4b1fc55c0e97d7aed1c6
Closes-Bug: 1379425

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-19 05:34:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Support for IPv6 RDNSS Option in Router Advts

RFC6106 standardizes IPv6 Router Advertisements to support
Recursive DNS server information. RDNSS info allows an IPv6
host to configure the DNS information via RA messages without
needing DHCPv6 for the DNS configuration.

This patch configures RADVD daemon to include RDNSS entries in
the Router Advertisements when the IPv6 subnet has dns_servers.

Closes-Bug: #1495465
Change-Id: Ia516d40b1c7a83cd7046b2b7f42d1204f44288a9

commit_message:
Support for IPv6 RDNSS Option in Router Advts

RFC6106 standardizes IPv6 Router Advertisements to support
Recursive DNS server information. RDNSS info allows an IPv6
host to configure the DNS information via RA messages without
needing DHCPv6 for the DNS configuration.

This patch configures RADVD daemon to include RDNSS entries in
the Router Advertisements when the IPv6 subnet has dns_nameservers.

Closes-Bug: #1495465
Change-Id: Ia516d40b1c7a83cd7046b2b7f42d1204f44288a9

commit_message:
Don't drop ARP table jump during OVS rewiring

The previous OVS ARP spoofing code was dropping the rule to jump to
the ARP protection table each time it was called. This call was
unnecessary since the majority of port updates are not turning
off port security.

This patch adjusts the logic to only drop the jump rule if port-sec
is disabled or if it is a network port. The existing functional tests
ensure that connectivity works as expected.

Closes-Bug: #1520013
Change-Id: I7b396d758c2d4c7e1004257d432b210bf3ee5c66
(cherry picked from commit ea4165c2af2ad5c7b5423e25c507598ebd30f7b5)

commit_message:
Don't drop ARP table jump during OVS rewiring

The previous OVS ARP spoofing code was dropping the rule to jump to
the ARP protection table each time it was called. This call was
unnecessary since the majority of port updates are not turning
off port security.

This patch adjusts the logic to only drop the jump rule if port-sec
is disabled or if it is a network port. The existing functional tests
ensure that connectivity works as expected.

Closes-Bug: #1520013
Change-Id: I7b396d758c2d4c7e1004257d432b210bf3ee5c66
(cherry picked from commit ea4165c2af2ad5c7b5423e25c507598ebd30f7b5)

commit_message:
Fix options for pluto per-peer logging

--perpeerlogbase option has no effect without --perpeerlog. [1]
Moreover there is no need to create 'logs' dir as there is a 'log'
dir that can be reused.

Also fixed indentation issue for enable_detailed_logging option
declaration.

[1] http://linux.die.net/man/8/ipsec_pluto

DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1308730
Change-Id: Ie5ef72c2abd83b9b1114d90a6c7294cc34174018
(cherry picked from commit ff49617ff7ac8f0d7268c862cc0cc4628cff9991)

commit_message:
Launch Instance Modal should be exist as a Service

Extracted openLaunchInstanceWizard from the
LaunchInstanceModalController to a Service named
horizon.dashboard.project.workflow.launch-instance.modal.service

This service is required for the new Images panel
to create the launch instance modal pop up.

Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table
Change-Id: Id7177cbafbfb9094d03908b5f8eba52d00241817

commit_message:
Follow-up on PyMySQL support for Red Hat platforms

Rely on packaging dependencies to avoid issues caused by different
package names between Fedora and RHEL (python-PyMySQL vs python2-PyMySQL).

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245229/4/spec/classes/neutron_db_spec.rb
includes all the discussion that led to this.

Change-Id: I32406ad0937241d2a4a02e0e9778fc4929963d3e

commit_message:
Support of PyMySQL driver for MySQL backend

Add ability to use python-pymysql library as backend for MySQL
connections, and use it as default.

Update acceptance tests to use pyMySQL.

Change-Id: I625f1e6adb5ad581c293431d90d1a9e5578472d4
Docs: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/PyMySQL_evaluation

commit_message:
Preparation for default endpoint names rename

This patch prepares for changes of default endpoint names,
so that they match default_catalog name [1].

Such change is required because recent patch [2] used correct
default values, but currently endpoint names are still created
using invalid names by defaut. This means that using just default
values of puppet-openstack modules some functionality could not
work correctly (currently migration due to Cinder will look for
'Compute Service' endpoint, but instead 'nova' endpoint is present
in DB).

Also it seems that OpenStack components moved to naming according
to default catalog long time ago [3].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/etc/default_catalog.templates
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219284/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/141727/

Change-Id: I2a4dea90a159f1049efd1f37ef026921241f51cf
Partial-bug: #1506061

commit_message:
Ceilometer Integration

Outline an implementation for improving Trove's intergration
with Ceilometer.  New notifications will be generated for each
API call following the start|end|error pattern in use by other
Openstack projects.

Change-Id: I01856855dc614364db99d9b4855ebc1f92aa602c
Implements: blueprint ceilometer-integration

[{'created': '2015-09-15 01:41:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP : Objects from Bay - Services

Currently k8s objects (pod/rc/service) are read from the
database. In order for native clients to work, they must
be read from the ReST bay endpoint. To execute native
clients, we must have one truth of the state of the
system, not two as we do now. This patch proposes the
change to the Service object.

Seperate patch to pass bay_uuid as a parameter to
magnum CLI will be submitted.

Change-Id: Id5be7fba2eb8622fcfeb48068728e440a0af3f5e
Partially-Implements: bp objects-from-bay

commit_message:
Objects from Bay - Pods

Currently k8s objects (pod/rc/service) are read from the
database. In order for native clients to work, they must
be read from the ReST bay endpoint. To execute native
clients, we must have one truth of the state of the
system, not two as we do now. This patch proposes the
change to the Pod object.

Also, please refer to the related-bug as to the temporary changes
done to make the test work for other objects namely rc,
service. These changes will be removed when the object from bay
patches for all the k8s objects are merged as part of a seperate
patch.

Partially-Implements: bp objects-from-bay
Related-Bug: #1502367
Related-Bug: #1504379

Change-Id: Id5be7fba2eb8622fcfeb48068728e440a0af3f5e

commit_message:
Fix RC CLI to work with Object from Bay

Fix Service CLI to work with Object from Bay changes. Pass
the --bay argument and pass the bay_identifier.

For example:
magnum rc-show <rc> --bay <bay_identifier>

Closes-Bug : #1517274
Partially-Implements: bp objects-from-bay

Change-Id: Ia7e51f968ea86c61ed527ee45e63ba29bf600dc4

commit_message:
Functional: Raise Exception if bay created failed.

Some time on gate, bay creation is failed, stop testing other cases which
need to be run onside a bay.

Partially implements: blueprint swarm-functional-testing

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-24 18:41:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve metadata update operations

Currently our metadata operations in the DB and the API are less than
optimal, main issues are:

- To update metadata first we get all metadata in the API and add
  requested update metadata, then on the DB we retrieve each of the
  metadata keys and update one by one contents.
- When deletion of existing keys is requested in the DB we retrieve all
  metadata contents and for those that are not in the new metadata we
  retrieve the contents from the DB (again) and delete the entry.

This patch changes this so we no longer retrieve metadata in the API,
deletion does not retrieve any metadata from the DB and just makes 1
deletion request to the DB, and for changes we retrieve metadata once
and then issue a bulk change to create new entries and update existing
ones.

Change-Id: I12506541cca61282122e319e3504560f68df225b

commit_message:
Improve metadata update operations

Currently our metadata operations in the DB and the API are less than
optimal, main issues are:

- To update metadata first we get all metadata in the API and add
  requested update metadata, then on the DB we retrieve each of the
  metadata keys and update one by one contents.
- When deletion of existing keys is requested in the DB we retrieve all
  metadata contents and for those that are not in the new metadata we
  retrieve the contents from the DB (again) and delete the entry.

This patch changes this so we no longer retrieve metadata in the API,
deletion does not retrieve any metadata from the DB and just makes 1
deletion request to the DB, and for changes we retrieve metadata once
and then issue a bulk change to create new entries and update existing
ones.

Partial-Bug: #1238093
Change-Id: I12506541cca61282122e319e3504560f68df225b

commit_message:
Add documentation for HA ceilometer

HA ceilometer can work if the proper overrides
are configured. This patch adds documentation
regarding running ceilometer in an active/active
HA configuration, meaning workload paritioning
can be done across multiple polling agents and
notification agents.

Change-Id: I65402a66f465df8dc82a24460531fba3a24a8cf5
Closes-Bug: #1518005

commit_message:
Fixed issue with cacert parameter

We need to use parameter cacert instead of ca_file parameter
to work with CA certificates like python clients for other
OpenStack services.


Also fixed typo (after copy paste from Glance code).

(cherry picked from commit 1141dd59aff141bee6618806a4496b57c214c7c1)

Change-Id: Ibe36390aab2f2edb0fe7670f76f61caeb350d34b
Closes-Bug: #1487099

commit_message:
Remove py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I62db55ee1a9e7564a10a7284bd0e401b2cdbc580
Closes-Bug: 1519510
Depends-On: I4a2f860e8138bddb032418ee555e07a6fa0a3f3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 18:47:33.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/api/keystone.py'], 'message': "Use KSC auth's register_conf_options instead of oslo.cfg import

A newer keystoneclient is not happy with simply using oslo_config to
import the config group.  Instead, use register_conf_options()

Change-Id: I798dad7ad5bd90362e1fa10c2eecb3e1d5bade71
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use KSC auth's register_conf_options instead of oslo.cfg import

A newer keystoneclient is not happy with simply using oslo_config to
import the config group.  Instead, use register_conf_options()
from keystoneclient.auth.

Change-Id: I798dad7ad5bd90362e1fa10c2eecb3e1d5bade71

commit_message:
Disable heat-api-cloudwatch in undercloud install

By default this can be disabled, as nothing in the overcloud deployment
requires it. This will save us around 50Mb of memory in an undercloud
deployment.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I693556188460fb07df3e018402922c0a4ba2927c

revisions:

Added cyclic test case to tests/datalog/test_compile.py to expose issue.

Change-Id: Ib46ec2c422093d498d9e3d6d93327d8627bf286f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-14 02:05:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixed datalog cyclic dependecy inf loop bug

Purpose: remove infinite loop problem with cycle detection and enumeration

Changes:
- Added cyclic test case to tests/datalog/test_compile.py which fails pre-fix
(see patchset 1 py27 verification)
- Replaced faulty cycle enumeration facility with cycle detection facility with
a single sample cycle stored (for user feedback)

Notes:
- Full enumeration was not used by anything in the code, so I chose to implement
a simple, efficient fix without full enumeration.
- In the future, full enumeration may still be needed in the future
(eg. for detecting negative recursion)

Change-Id: Ib46ec2c422093d498d9e3d6d93327d8627bf286f

commit_message:
Fixed datalog cyclic dependecy inf loop bug

Purpose: remove infinite loop problem with cycle detection and enumeration

Changes:
- Added cyclic test case to tests/datalog/test_compile.py which fails pre-fix
(see patchset 1 py27 verification)
- Replaced faulty cycle enumeration facility with cycle detection facility with
a single sample cycle stored (for user feedback)

Notes:
- Full enumeration was not used by anything in the code, so I chose to implement
a simple, efficient fix without full enumeration.
- In the future, full enumeration may still be needed in the future
(eg. for detecting negative recursion)

Change-Id: Ib46ec2c422093d498d9e3d6d93327d8627bf286f

subject: Fix POD CLI to work with Object from Bay
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-26 00:08:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix POD CLI to work with Object from Bay

Fix POD CLI to work with Object from Bay changes. Construct
the REST URL for each API since now with Object from Bay changes
its mandatory to pass a bay identifier. Also, in the list
API explicitly pass the bay_ident for which the query is
supposed to be made.

Change-Id: Iecc7f710d4270d2e21cae718c19307f8ee011127
Partially-Implements: bp objects-from-bay
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-30 21:45:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix POD CLI to work with Object from Bay

Fix POD CLI to work with Object from Bay changes. Construct
the REST URL for each API since now with Object from Bay changes
its mandatory to pass a bay identifier. Also, in the list
API explicitly pass the bay_ident for which the query is
supposed to be made. The help is also updated so that user
can see provide positional arguments.

For example:

commit_message:
Fix POD CLI to work with Object from Bay

Fix POD CLI to work with Object from Bay changes. Construct
the REST URL for each API since now with Object from Bay changes
its mandatory to pass a bay identifier. Also, in the list
API explicitly pass the bay_ident for which the query is
supposed to be made. The help is also updated so that user
can see provide positional arguments.

For example:
magnum pod-show <pod-identifier> --bay <>

Change-Id: Iecc7f710d4270d2e21cae718c19307f8ee011127
Partially-Implements: bp objects-from-bay

commit_message:
Fix pylint/astroid breakage

Using test-requirements.txt to pin pylint to 1.4.4 and astroid (a dependency
of pylint) to less than 1.4.0, as newer versions break pylint 1.4.4.

Change-Id: I0e39d88fdcc74f2bfec331d26567a18560fbc3a0

commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 support from python-novaclient

Since oslo is removing support for python 2.6, nova
needs to also remove support from clients and libraries.
This commit is to remove support from python-novaclient.

-- Python 2.6 compatibilty code was removed.
-- Python 2.6 was removed as a tox environment, install venv,
and from the classifiers in setup.cfg.
-- Release notes have been updated.

UpgradeImpact

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <andr.kurilin@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I3f587ff38d478d075af5fd014e2b4b8416e185d4
Closes-bug: 1518390

commit_message:
fix grenade jobs for a post-juno world

drop references to juno.

stop running grenade on kilo (as juno is no longer a thing).

consolidate some of the kilo skips under a single run instead of
having a bunch of separate rules.

Change-Id: Ib886951eb6a773f429e51e4fc1ff9fca046c508e

commit_message:
Check cluster if it is None before run job

We should check the return value of conductor.cluster_get(), if
the return value is None, we should return directly.

Change-Id: I55ad18b127798913878fde1d00f4e5ad7b4994c5
Closes-Bug: #1519237

ones that snuck in.

commit_message:
Multipath Device Action Being Parsed as Name

Whenever find_multipath_device() was being called on an action
it would include the action as part of the device name. This patch
creates a list of actions and checks that they aren't preceding
the device name before parsing the rest of the device information
in find_multipath_device().

This patch is based on the approach that was taken in Nova until
it was abandoned in favor of the change being made in os-brick
instead. The Change-Id for the Nova change:
I8f1f769bb15ec10054e2fd73c4cf621389014cf1

Change-Id: I12a10ba189e4987cdf07bebdadbac0d4587c01d1
Closes-Bug: 1466444

[{'created': '2015-11-30 23:34:05.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connector.py'], 'message': "Fix iopsLimit parameter in ScaleIO connector

The parameter 'iops_limit' in the ScaleIO connector
is wrong. The correct parameter should be 'iopsLimit'.
Because of this error, the iops of the volume will stay
unlimited even if the user sets a limit on the iops.

Closes-Bug: #1521396
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix iopsLimit parameter in ScaleIO connector

The parameter 'iops_limit' in the ScaleIO connector
is wrong. The correct parameter should be 'iopsLimit'.
Because of this error, the iops of the volume will stay
unlimited even if the user sets a limit on the iops.
This patch fixes this error.

Change-Id: I6b9212e9046bf3e2c9bbbde6354c298b359de3a6
Closes-Bug: #1521396

Change-Id: I798dad7ad5bd90362e1fa10c2eecb3e1d5bade71

commit_message:
Use KSC auth's register_conf_options instead of oslo.cfg import

A newer keystoneclient is not happy with simply using oslo_config to
import the config group.  Instead, use register_conf_options()
from keystoneclient.auth.

Change-Id: I798dad7ad5bd90362e1fa10c2eecb3e1d5bade71

commit_message:
Remove py26 support from muranoclient

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

commit_message:
Remove py26 support from fuelclient

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I3ea60260b467710a3e287d88e026f72060f63a1d
Closes-Bug: 1519510

', 'number': 21}, {'created': '2015-10-01 00:00:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add cert tracking and rotating in Housekeeping

The target of this patch is to add the function that once we detect an 
amphora's cert will expire in 2 weeks from utcnow, we will update its
cert with a new one and update its db information at the same time.

In order to achieve this target, I did the following changes:

Add 2 new columns cert_busy and cert_expiration in amphora table
Add methods to get cert expiration date from PEM server_pem and 
update db info
Use the new REST agent method to perform cycling
Add process in housekeeping to facilitate rotation
Add unit tests

This patch depends on the following 2 bugs:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/octavia/+bug/1496634
https://bugs.launchpad.net/octavia/+bug/1496628

Deponds-on: I6ed139e67f2507829dadd82f3adfd99ad6851608
Change-Id: I28578a3e560ee09ba300788a5423863c893b8638

commit_message:
Add cert tracking and rotating in Housekeeping

The goal of this patch is to add the function that once we detect an
amphora's cert will expire in 2 weeks from utcnow, we will update its
cert with a new one and update its db information at the same time.

In order to achieve this target, I did the following changes:

Add 2 new columns cert_busy and cert_expiration in amphora table
Add methods to get cert expiration date from PEM server_pem and
update db info
Use the new REST agent method to perform cycling
Add process in housekeeping to facilitate rotation
Add unit tests

Change-Id: I28578a3e560ee09ba300788a5423863c893b8638

commit_message:
Add '-H -E' options to pass proxy env for sudo

'sudo python /tmp/get-pip.py' command call not working with proxy
env, so add '-H -E' sudo options to pass proxy env to get-pip.py.

Change-Id: If60bacc130d311f7694dba108bf922b393c1017c
Closes-bug: #1519596

commit_message:
Fix site-packages path for python 2.7

CentOS7 comes with python2.7 included, so we need to
update path to site-packages directory

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Compatible with CentOS6 & CentOS7 master node

Change-Id: Ifa7026ef5e090d740797567e99dae0f08e41c310

commit_message:
Remove py26 support

As of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.
Closes-Bug: 1519510

Change-Id: Ie8dc40df5fddce298f31f7a3d5436493b9b090bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-30 22:01:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixing pep8 failures

Looks like newer pylint is having issues with files. Fixing.

Change-Id: I0e39d88fdcc74f2bfec331d26567a18560fbc3a0
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-01 02:03:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Pinning pylint/astroid versions

Found three issues. First, plylint 1.5.0 identifies new lint errors
that didn't occur before. One of those, is with import ordering,
which it falsely reports that the import for configparser should be
before the import for eventlet, but the configparser import is
inside an if-clause that uses the six module. Moving that up, will
result in an error as six is not imported yet, and moving six up,
gives an ordering warning for six. Will likely need to disable that
warning for this file. In general, we need to asses whether 1.5.0
will work, and will need to revise the code to accomodate this
version.

Second, pylint is not pinned to any version, and can vary at any
time, which can cause a problem, if a newer pylint version has
an issue. Pylint 1.4.4 is used in neutron currently, and was used
in this repo previously.

Third, the astroid package, which is a dependency for pylint,
was updated from 1.3.8 to 1.4.1, which is broken, when used with
pylint 1.4.4 (as is astroid 1.4.0).  A bug has been reported on
astroid upstream. There is no pin for astroid either, unless the
gate-neturon-pep8-constraints job is used (which it is not for this
repo).

This commit does the following, until we can update tools:

- Pin pylint to 1.4.4
- Pin astroid to 1.3.8
- Remove the dependancy from tox.ini, which interferes with any
  pinning in test-requirements.txt
- Addressing some of the errors that were seen with pylint 1.5.0
  (cannot do all, as some changes are incompatible with 1.4.4, like
  the import ordering mentioned above).

Change-Id: I0e39d88fdcc74f2bfec331d26567a18560fbc3a0
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-12-01 15:30:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix pylint/astroid breakage

Found that pylint 1.5.0 and astroid 1.4.1 generate new errors for pylint
testing. Also, if pin pylint to 1.4.4, which is done in neutron, will have
breakage, because pylint 1.4.4 is not compatible with astroid 1.4.x.

For now, fix is to pin these two in tox.ini to pylint 1.4.4 and astroid
1.3.8.

Later, can implement pep8-constraints job and target for VPN repo, and
that will handle the constraints.

In long term, can migrate to pylint 1.5.0 and resolve the warnings/errors
that crop up. Note: looks like the fixes are not backwards compatible.

Will see if this commit will force pep8 job to use the "right" versions.

Change-Id: I0e39d88fdcc74f2bfec331d26567a18560fbc3a0
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-12-01 19:13:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix pylint/astroid breakage

incompatible version (1.4.1) of astroid being used with pylint.

Change-Id: I0e39d88fdcc74f2bfec331d26567a18560fbc3a0

commit_message:
Fix pylint/astroid breakage

Using test-requirements.txt to pin pylint to 1.4.4 and astroid (a dependency
of pylint) less than 1.4.0. This will resolve current breakage caused by an
incompatible version (1.4.1) of astroid being used with pylint 1.4.4.

Change-Id: I0e39d88fdcc74f2bfec331d26567a18560fbc3a0

commit_message:
Remove py26 support from ganttclient

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I3ecb1a28a0dcde0c7a95d4aa6efd2dc058fa2dbd
Closes-Bug: 1519510

commit_message:
Fix for the broken header's dropdowns for both v0.11.2 and v0.13

The dropdownToggle directive from angular-ui/bootstrap v0.11.2
conflicts with the native Bootstrap data-toggle="dropdown" attribute
(see https:github.com/angular-ui/bootstrap/issues/2156). This is fixed
in 0.13, but before that it'd be valuable to ensure that the same html
markup works the same way with both versions of angular-ui/bootstrap
(0.11.2 and 0.13). The decorator code could be safely deleted once
Horizon migrates to angular-ui/bootstrap v0.13.

Also fix dropdowns in material theme templates.

Closes-Bug: #1466146
Change-Id: I8f01c1ce7b0a5dc29bf9d8aba23c9ea7e6e1ec35

commit_message:
Fix Download get-pip play in vagrant.yml

Fixes syntax for get_url module in ansible playbook vagrant.yml
which was causing the vagrant up command to fail.

Change-Id: Iffb0b17c8f808b33538b06d21c52ca603f018a9c
Closes-Bug: 1521750

commit_message:
[microversions] Increase max version to 2.7

2.7 - Check the is_public attribute of a flavor before adding tenant
access to it. Reject the request with HTTPConflict error.

Since novaclient already have Conflict expection, there is no required
changes on client side.

Change-Id: I48dca20b3795185363367bac0e2ee65ce938593f

commit_message:
Remove py26 support from swiftclient

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

[{'created': '2015-10-05 22:56:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add useful 'time_it' decorator

Create a helpful decorator that can be attached to functions
or methods to show how long they take to run; internally it
uses a stop watch and provided logger to log with (and an
optional logging level to use).

An example:

>>> from oslo_utils import timeutils
>>> import logging
>>> import time
>>> logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG)
>>> logger = logging.getLogger()
>>>
>>> @timeutils.time_it(logger)
... def a():
...   time.sleep(0.2)
...
>>> a()
DEBUG:root:It took 0.20 seconds to run function '__main__.a'

commit_message:
Add useful 'time_it' decorator

Create a helpful decorator that can be attached to functions
or methods to show how long they take to run; internally it
uses a stop watch and provided logger to log with (and an
optional logging level to use).

An example:

>>> from oslo_utils import timeutils
>>> import logging
>>> import time
>>> logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG)
>>> logger = logging.getLogger()
>>>
>>> @timeutils.time_it(logger)
... def a():
...   time.sleep(0.2)
...
>>> a()
DEBUG:root:It took 0.20 seconds to run function '__main__.a'

Change-Id: Ia41d5b6910f7ebe2dd93aaf6ca1defe158f8310c

commit_message:
Moving exception specification

Horizon defines classes of exception from the services it
communicates with. In the plugin case, the plugin needs to set
up including plugin content specific exceptions to the classes of
exceptions in Horizon. This patch includes this content.

Setting up an extensible exception list in exceptions.py and
including the exceptions in the configuration files.

Change-Id: Ie91cfe1e0f34a710a96b4a43cf62af35d989920c

commit_message:
Ipv4 DHCP support without running the DHCP agent

We fully support distributed Ipv4 DHCP, if the deployment
is IPv4 only no need for the dhcp agent it could be removed
from the installation. the plugin will take care of the
DHCP server port creation.

In case the deployment use IPv6 the dhcp agent need to be
installed and the neutron server need to be configured
with additional variable.

use_centralized_ipv6_DHCP=True

This extra setting could be removed once we implement
the Ipv6 distributed DHCP SDN application
Change-Id: I48f38f80886dc564f8da788959acc70df3cf2180

commit_message:
Move type formatting from generator to type

This change moves the formatting for each type into each class for that
type. Each type now has control over its own formatting rather than
being under the generators purview. This allows developers to create
their own types in their project and set its it's own formatting.
Refactoring the layout this way also makes it easier to create new types
and update existing types. Another benefit could be that outputting the
config can be detached from the generator which is specifically for
generating config files.

Change-Id: I7cf94a1b2cbbfe67282e8a157548caff825d2811

commit_message:
[install] do not use swift password between ""  or ''.

An error occurs when you use a password for the user swift (in keystone)
between "" or '' in /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf.

backport: kilo
Closes-Bug: #1487051

Change-Id: I83f79e3f7a1eac0b39827c751e4de1ced4049619

commit_message:
Remove py26 support from designateclient

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I479081c88b53175def2a5ea06ee1d3435ed6444e
Closes-Bug: 1519510

commit_message:
Remove py26 support from cinderclient

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I6f9f7dcb4e454f4d1e12943a1f4a1ab3ced0eba3
Closes-Bug: 1519510

commit_message:
Remove py26 jobs from manilaclient

Support of py26 is going to be dropped in CI and already is dropped
in manilaclient dependencies. So, remove this job from manilaclient.

Change-Id: Ia6b8fdc6ef53235fef1be07c3deb05b0d9117878
Related-Bug: 1519510

- Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent (e.g openstack

commit_message:
Fix delete quota of subprojects

This patch aims to fix the bug in which cinder raises
an error when performing a delete quota operation in
a subproject.

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a project A in keystone (e.g openstack project create A);
- Create a project B in keystone with A as its parent (e.g openstack
  project create B --property parent_id=<id of project A>);
- Update the quota value of A (e.g. openstack quota set
  <id of project A> --volume 5)
- Update the quota value of B (e.g. openstack quota set
  <id of project B> --volume 2)
- Try to delete the quota of B (e.g. cinder quota-delete
  <id of project B>)

Change-Id: Id1a749433c3679f1b2adf87ea0a280366c5e4a15
Closes-bug: #1496058

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 08:59:27.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Remove py26 support from python-neutronclient

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I4a2f860e8138bddb032418ee555e07a6fa0a3f3e
Closes-Bug: 1519510
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove py26 support from python-neutronclient

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I4a2f860e8138bddb032418ee555e07a6fa0a3f3e
Closes-Bug: 1519510

subject: Do not allow name lookups on RBAC policies
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 11:23:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/rbac.py'], 'message': 'Do not allow name lookups on RBAC policies

RBAC policies have no name field so the name query to
the server was always returning all entries since the
name filter was ignored.

This corrects the behavior by disabling the name lookup
for RBAC policies.

Change-Id: I6c5afa05cefb1709e9667a1aaf20105c707dc95c
Closes-Bug: #1517818
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not allow name lookups on RBAC policies

RBAC policies have no name field so the name query to
the server was always returning all entries since the
name filter was ignored.

This corrects the behavior by disabling the name lookup
for RBAC policies.

Change-Id: I6c5afa05cefb1709e9667a1aaf20105c707dc95c
Closes-Bug: #1517818

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 03:28:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34
we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch
puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem
to happen.
Closes-bug: #1489059
Change-Id: I9d3a79b865d7f3d86eca8f8dcaee598bbd917c19
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34
we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch
puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem
to happen.
Closes-bug: #1489059
Change-Id: I9d3a79b865d7f3d86eca8f8dcaee598bbd917c19

commit_message:
Add murano service broker to Fuel WEB

This patch add support of newly introduced murano service called
murano cfapi to Fuel UI.

Implements: bp implement-support-for-murano-service-broker
Change-Id: Ifc8a3861d82af13765cd0759de1846b431f057e9

[{'created': '2015-10-29 12:35:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add new URLs for APIs ported from extensions

Changes:
- New microversion added - 2.7
- Make new urls work starting with microversion 2.7
- Allow to use old URLs using microversions 2.0-2.6 and v1.

Partially implements bp ext-to-core

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-10-30 13:04:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add new URLs for APIs ported from extensions

After port of extensions to core API we need to rename its URLs.

So, rename URLs and bump microversion for it.
Make new URls work only with new microversion(s) 2.7+
and old with old microversions 1.0-2.6.
Add separate API router for v2 API as now we should split v1 and v2
logic.
Also, move updated APIs under v2 directory that will be used by both
API routers - v1 and v2.

List of updated URLs is following:

+----------------------+---------------------+
|     Old (1.0-2.6)    |      New (2.7+)     |
+----------------------+---------------------+
| os-availability-zone |  availability-zones |
+----------------------+---------------------+
|      os-services     |       services      |
+----------------------+---------------------+
|     os-quota-sets    |      quota-sets     |
+----------------------+---------------------+
|  os-quota-class-sets |   quota-class-sets  |
+----------------------+---------------------+

Partially implements bp ext-to-core

Change-Id: I82f00114db985b4b3bf4db0a64191559508ac600

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-11-03 17:31:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add new URLs for APIs ported from extensions

After port of extensions to core API we need to rename its URLs.

So, rename URLs and bump microversion for it.
Make new URls work only with new microversion(s) 2.7+
and old with old microversions 1.0-2.6.
Add separate API router for v2 API as now we should split v1 and v2
logic.
Also, move updated APIs under v2 directory that will be used by both
API routers - v1 and v2.

List of updated collections is following:

+----------------------+---------------------+
|     Old (1.0-2.6)    |      New (2.7+)     |
+----------------------+---------------------+
| os-availability-zone |  availability-zones |
+----------------------+---------------------+
|      os-services     |       services      |
+----------------------+---------------------+
|     os-quota-sets    |      quota-sets     |
+----------------------+---------------------+
|  os-quota-class-sets |   quota-class-sets  |
+----------------------+---------------------+
|    os-share-manage   |    shares/manage    |
+----------------------+---------------------+
|   os-share-unmanage  |   shares/%s/action  |
+----------------------+---------------------+

List of updated member actions is following:

+----------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
|                 Old (1.0-2.6)                |                      New (2.7+)                 |
+----------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
|    os-share-unmanage/%(share_id)s/unmanage   |              shares/%(share_id)s/action         |
+----------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| types/%(share_type_id)s/os-share-type-access |    types/%(share_type_id)s/share_type_access    |
+----------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+

List of updated action names is following:

+------------------+---------------+
|   Old (1.0-2.6)  |   New (2.7+)  |
+------------------+---------------+
| os-access_allow  | access_allow  |
+------------------+---------------+
|  os-access_deny  |  access_deny  |
+------------------+---------------+
|  os-access_list  |  access_list  |
+------------------+---------------+
|  os-reset_status | reset_status  |
+------------------+---------------+
| os-force_delete  | force_delete  |
+------------------+---------------+
| os-migrate_share | migrate_share |
+------------------+---------------+
|     os-extend    |     extend    |
+----------------------+-----------+
|     os-shrink    |     shrink    |
+------------------+---------------+

Partially implements bp ext-to-core

So, rename URLs and bump microversion for it.
Make new URls work only with new microversion(s) 2.7+

Add separate API router for v2 API as now we should split v1 and v2
logic.
Also, move updated APIs under v2 directory that will be used by both
API routers - v1 and v2.

List of updated collections is following:
 - os-availability-zone -> availability-zones
 - os-services -> services
 - os-quota-sets -> quota-sets
 - os-quota-class-sets -> quota-class-sets
 - os-share-manage -> shares/manage
 - os-share-unmanage -> shares/%s/action

List of updated member actions is following:
 - os-share-unmanage/%(share_id)s/unmanage -> shares/%(share_id)s/action
 - types/%(id)s/os-share-type-access -> types/%(id)s/share_type_access

List of updated action names is following:
 - os-access_allow -> access_allow
 - os-access_deny -> access_deny
 - os-access_list -> access_list
 - os-reset_status -> reset_status
 - os-force_delete -> force_delete
 - os-migrate_share -> migrate_share

commit_message:
Add new URLs for APIs ported from extensions

After port of extensions to core API we need to rename their URLs.

So, rename URLs and bump microversion for it.
Make new URLs work only with new microversion(s) 2.7+
and old with old microversions 1.0-2.6.
Add separate API router for v2 API as now we should split v1 and v2
logic.
Also, move updated APIs under v2 directory that will be used by both
API routers - v1 and v2.

List of updated collections is following:
 - os-availability-zone -> availability-zones
 - os-services -> services
 - os-quota-sets -> quota-sets
 - os-quota-class-sets -> quota-class-sets
 - os-share-manage -> shares/manage
 - os-share-unmanage -> shares/%s/action

List of updated member actions is following:
 - os-share-unmanage/%(share_id)s/unmanage -> shares/%(share_id)s/action
 - types/%(id)s/os-share-type-access -> types/%(id)s/share_type_access

List of updated action names is following:
 - os-access_allow -> access_allow
 - os-access_deny -> access_deny
 - os-access_list -> access_list
 - os-reset_status -> reset_status
 - os-force_delete -> force_delete
 - os-migrate_share -> migrate_share
 - os-extend -> extend
 - os-shrink -> shrink

List of updated attribute names is following:
 - os-share-type-access -> share-type-access

Partially implements bp ext-to-core

Change-Id: I82f00114db985b4b3bf4db0a64191559508ac600

commit_message:
Use skip_checks to define class level skip condition

check_preconditions() method is no longer available in tempest.
So,  this commit is to use skip_checks to define class level
skip conditions

Closes-Bug:#1517329
Change-Id: I5d09da7416c040c57731cc8ea3ab519111834fab

commit_message:
Add avilability zones and its fields into nova driver

The current nova client provides availability zones and its fields
(name and state). In order to specify a policy for availability
zone and its state, we need this availability zone information
in nova driver. The new column field is zone.

Change-Id: If5967cd33713485b627a64c4ab5235ba89d99fe1
Implements: blueprint add-az-to-nova-driver

commit_message:
Add a unique prefix to the `groupedRuns` route.

This adds a unique prefix to the `groupedRuns` route to ensure that
it doesn't conflict with any other routes. Currently its catchall
route mapping will prevent any lower-precedence routes from
loading; this prefixes all grouped run pages with '/g/` to prevent
conflicts while keeping the intended 'invalid route' behavior of
redirecting to '/'.

Change-Id: Ifdd72efa903c56a4367cbe3b95384208c7c8c187

subject: Fixed datalog/utility Graph cycle enumeration inf loop bug
revisions:

Purpose: remove infinite loop problem with cycle detection and enumeration

Changes:

- Fixed faulty cycle enumeration code in datalog/utility.py
- Added Graph constructor from cycle list to facilicate testing

commit_message:
Fixed datalog/utility Graph cycle enumeration inf loop bug

Purpose: remove infinite loop problem with cycle detection and enumeration

Changes:
datalog/ulitity.py:
- Rewrote dfs, simplifying logic, adding target search
-- Used a stack instead of dictionary to track dfs history
-- Avoided mixing different histories, which caused the problem (line 169)
- Added _enumerate_cycles(), using dfs from every node to find cycles
beginning and ending in that node

Change-Id: Ic42186c2fa9701ae74f5914676e35cda6ce8389d

commit_message:
Remove flavors.get_flavor() only used in tests

This method is only used in tests and all it really do is calling the
object method Flavor.get_by_id().

Lets remove it and call with object method directly instead.

Change-Id: I93d57b14cd60fe5c6a24573a74b691c01fb10563

commit_message:
add more heat.conf settings to heat, engine classes

heat.conf settings added:

 max_template_size
 max_json_body_size
 max_resources_per_stack
 notification_driver
 instance_connection_https_validate_certificates
 instance_connection_is_secure

Change-Id: I00db48bb7e5fde7ba1048fc1cb24fcdcf4e85c04

commit_message:
Skip cleaning of MD containers

Add possibility to skip cleaning of MD containers which are usually
represent fake RAID devices. So, those devices won't be cleaned
and removed at the partitioning step. That will effectively save
those devices for further provisioning purposes.

In order to preserve existing behavior, it will be disabled by
default in conf file.

Will be enabled in a separate patch.

Change-Id: I7be1fc438ffe1fec9b8bfae7e47f50cd3a7c36b7
Related-Bug: #1508908

trivial: Make use of 'CPU(Thread)Allocation' enum

Rather than using hard-coded strings, make use of the values provided
by the aformentioned enum value.

Implements: blueprint virt-driver-cpu-thread-pinning

commit_message:
deprecate python26 support

We already decide to deprecate py26 test in CI.
Since the check already broken in client, this patch propose to
remove py26 from check. The gate will be drprecated too.

See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-November/051551.html

Change-Id: If726843004657e3ca8b1a1125093fcfc693ddd1c

commit_message:
relax id validation

we want uuid, unfortunately most of openstack is a mess so we can't
have nice things. this patch makes it so we continue to allow basically
anything that is a string but we warn that they should stop this.

Change-Id: I2a89aed143c22b9a3e2261d5473af93c1cad67cd
Closes-Bug: #1521844

subject: Use None resource for everything in validation
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-25 07:25:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use None resource for everything in validation

Since Heat started conditionaly expose resources based on available
services, the template-validate gate is broken, as validation fails for
most of used resources as the corresponding services are not installed
on the gating system (we install only Keystone and Heat there).

Introducing a default global environment to validate call that swaps
all OS::*::* and AWS::*::* resources to OS::Heat::None

commit_message:
Use None resource for everything in validation

Since Heat started conditionaly expose resources based on available
services, the template-validate gate is broken, as validation fails for
most of used resources as the corresponding services are not installed
on the gating system (we install only Keystone and Heat there).

Introducing a default global environment to validate call that swaps
all OS::*::* and AWS::*::* resources to OS::Heat::None

Change-Id: I08fb57870c6ff21887421a58592f7131c5050e9c
Closes-Bug: #1492115
Depends-On: I5b56c71b5575b73432b0e24df1dc8f8402c17a0c

[{'created': '2015-11-26 16:35:29.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/tests/test_coordination.py'], 'message': 'tests: allow ipc to bypass blocking=False test

Running the tests on a system with IPC that does not support
non-blocking lock make the test thread fail, and then waiting forever on

Allow the test to pass if the driver raises NotImplemented.

Change-Id: I2c9e29d317895080cdb6db7109b2528b8d7761ab
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
tests: allow ipc to bypass blocking=False test

Running the tests on a system with IPC that does not support
non-blocking lock make the test thread fail, and then waiting forever on
the thread.

Allow the test to pass if the driver raises NotImplemented.

Change-Id: I2c9e29d317895080cdb6db7109b2528b8d7761ab

commit_message:
Remove file dmraid2mdadm.cfg

This file is actually a snippet which's configuring default kernel
options for grub2 regarding dmraid/mdadm.

* Remove `nomdadmddf` and `nomdadmism` flags from cmdline of target image
https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-devel/2014-February/038099.html

Removing of these specific kernel options will let us use mdadm for
Intel Matrix Raid and DDF fakeraid arrays.

We hadn't used dmraid for this kind of stuff, neither had we offered
any kind of support for fake raid prior that change. So, it's safe to
remove those options completely without any doubts.

Change-Id: I682dfd44cad1ef8e993ead79b6dcd345c7b3b322
Related-Bug: #1508908

commit_message:
Add decorator that can be used to ensure a driver is capable

To ensure that a driver is capable enough to call a method that
is implemented on it, move away from raising 'tooz.NotImplemented'
manually in the method and instead raise 'tooz.NotImplemented' based
on requested and actual capabilities.

Change-Id: I4c53451b5952a27e49242156c4f4550ac2e9ad11

commit_message:
Support older notifications set_override keys

Neutron and Ceilometer use set_override to set
the older deprecated key. We should support them
using the ConfFixture

Closes-Bug: #1521776

commit_message:
Rerun network setup on deployed nodes

This is required to apply changes that could be made to the networking
configuration of environment.
The major case is: add/remove node network group(s).

The configuration changes are not tracked as nailgun does not have
proper functionality for that.

New key is introduced in task description: reexecute_on (list).
Deployment tasks which are to be re-executed on deploy changes must have

reexecute_on:
  - deploy_changes

DocImpact

Change-Id: I668fcb426826cecf69a5c7fc1e92b8ae8dfeef9f
Blueprint: redeploy-network-on-changes

subject: Limit version of keystonemiddleware to before 4
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 11:30:42.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Limit version of keystonemiddleware to before 4

Major version 4 fixed the way options were handled, but broke our code.
We could probably fix into Gnocchi, but it's simpler to just limit
people to an old Keystonemiddleware. Future version of Gnocchi won't
depend on it anyway.

Change-Id: Ie657c9dd874bed61118fec1b28abd4a6fa05c010
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Limit version of keystonemiddleware to before 4

Major version 4 fixed the way options were handled, but broke our code.
We could probably fix into Gnocchi, but it's simpler to just limit
people to an old Keystonemiddleware. Future version of Gnocchi won't
depend on it anyway.

Change-Id: Ie657c9dd874bed61118fec1b28abd4a6fa05c010

commit_message:
Allow for providing different run work sync functions

It can be quite useful to replace the running of work
function in the sync executor with a function that logs
or with a function that shows whats running, or other
so enable that replacement by having a new sync executor
parameter that can be provided to give alternate functions
that run work items.

Change-Id: I8f4a806ed698370b4f5a300d74ee507cbe4eebc5

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 13:10:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ability to define the mtu globally (for all the container networks)

Currently, deployers can override MTUs on a per-network basis,
but may be looking for a way to define the mtu globally.

This implements a variable named ``lxc_container_default_mtu``
that currently defaults to 1500 (standard value). If this variable
is set, it will globally override the mtu, while still keeping the

but may be looking for a way to define the mtu globally.

commit_message:
Ability to define the mtu globally (for all the container networks)

Currently, deployers can override MTUs on a per-network basis,
but may be looking for a way to define the mtu globally.

This implements a variable named ``lxc_container_default_mtu``
that currently defaults to 1500 (standard value). If this variable
is set, it will globally override the mtu, while still keeping the
per-network override.

Closes-Bug: #1518311

Change-Id: Ic8b9884acc45cb62d9ab25ae0267cf4c026ece33

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 8040, 'name': 'Timur Sufiev', 'email': 'tsufiev@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsufiev'}, {'_account_id': 9647, 'name': 'Justin Pomeroy', 'email': 'jpomero@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'jpomero'}, {'_account_id': 9981, 'name': 'Doug Fish', 'email': 'drfish@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'doug-fish'}, {'_account_id': 11902, 'name': 'Randy Bertram', 'email': 'rbertram@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'rbertram'}, {'_account_id': 13325, 'name': 'Paul Karikh', 'email': 'pkarikh@gmail.com', 'username': 'paul.karikh'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-08-08 01:23:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add identity v3 API filtering to users and projects tables

This adds API filtering to the Users and Projects tables when
using the identity v3 API. It depends on the initial API filtering
support. The API_RESULT_LIMIT setting is used as the maximum
number of items to display in the table. If more than the max
number are returned then a warning message is displayed telling
the user to use a filter to narrow down the results.

Closes-Bug: #1321483
Change-Id: I7f2a0567d685decde84f34b345fa1827bd3d8ac5

Change-Id: I7f2a0567d685decde84f34b345fa1827bd3d8ac5
', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2014-08-13 18:11:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add identity v3 API filtering to users and projects tables

This adds API filtering to the Users and Projects tables when
using the identity v3 API. The new table_row_limit setting from
HORIZON_CONFIG is used as the maximum number of rows to display
in the table. If more than the max number are returned then a
warning message is displayed telling the user to use a filter to
narrow down the results.

Experiments have shown that the Users table takes 20 seconds to
load when there are 1000 users. Certainly this number will depend
on many variables. The default row rendering limit of 500 was
chosen based on these results with the assumptions that loading
the page with 500 users would take roughly 10 seconds and that
showing any more than 500 of anything on a page is not very
useful. These assumptions are of course open to debate.

It seems at the moment that user email and project description
fields are not filterable in identity v3, so the only field
that can currently be filtered on these tables is the name.

Closes-Bug: #1321483
Change-Id: I7f2a0567d685decde84f34b345fa1827bd3d8ac5
', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2014-08-14 14:50:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add identity v3 API filtering to users and projects tables

This adds API filtering to the Users and Projects tables when
using the identity v3 API. The new table_row_limit setting from
HORIZON_CONFIG is used as the maximum number of rows to display
in the table. If more than the max number are returned then the
data is truncated and a warning message is displayed telling the
user to use a filter to narrow down the results.

Experiments have shown that the Users page takes about 20 seconds
to load when there are 1049 users. Certainly this number will
depend on many variables, but of that 20 seconds only 0.37 seconds
is spent making the request to obtain the data. The 0.37 seconds
was obtained by using curl to make the request to list the users.
So the vast majority of the time seems to be spent rendering the
page. The default row rendering limit of 500 was chosen based on
these results with the assumptions that loading the page with 500
users would take roughly 10 seconds and that showing any more than
500 of anything on a page is not very useful. These assumptions are
of course open to debate.

It seems at the moment that user email and project description
fields are not filterable in identity v3, so the only field
that can currently be filtered on these tables is the name.

This patch also includes some general improvements to the API
filtering support in horizon and fixes an issue that will occur
if API filtering is used on a table with inline editing.

Closes-Bug: #1321483
Change-Id: I7f2a0567d685decde84f34b345fa1827bd3d8ac5
', 'number': 9}, {'created': '2014-08-19 14:39:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add identity v3 API filtering to users and projects tables

was obtained by using curl to make the request to list the users.
So the vast majority of the time seems to be spent rendering the
page. The default row rendering limit of 500 was chosen based on
these results with the assumptions that loading the page with 500
users would take roughly 10 seconds and that showing any more than
500 of anything on a page is not very useful. These assumptions are
of course open to debate.

It seems at the moment that user email and project description
fields are not filterable in identity v3, so the only field
that can currently be filtered on these tables is the name.

This patch also includes some general improvements to the API
filtering support in horizon and fixes an issue that will occur
if API filtering is used on a table with inline editing.

Closes-Bug: #1321483
Change-Id: I7f2a0567d685decde84f34b345fa1827bd3d8ac5

commit_message:
Add identity v3 API filtering to users and projects tables

This adds API filtering to the Users and Projects tables when
using the identity v3 API. The new table_row_limit setting from
HORIZON_CONFIG is used as the maximum number of rows to display
in the table. If more than the max number are returned then the
data is truncated and a warning message is displayed telling the
user to use a filter to narrow down the results.

Experiments have shown that the Users page takes about 20 seconds
to load when there are 1049 users. Certainly this number will
depend on many variables, but of that 20 seconds only 0.37 seconds
is spent making the request to obtain the data. The 0.37 seconds
was obtained by using curl to make the request to list the users.
So the vast majority of the time seems to be spent rendering the
page. The default row rendering limit of 500 was chosen based on
these results with the assumptions that loading the page with 500
users would take roughly 10 seconds and that showing any more than
500 of anything on a page is not very useful. These assumptions are
of course open to debate.

It seems at the moment that user email and project description
fields are not filterable in identity v3, so the only field
that can currently be filtered on these tables is the name.

This patch also includes some general improvements to the API
filtering support in horizon and fixes an issue that will occur
if API filtering is used on a table with inline editing.

Closes-Bug: #1321483
Change-Id: I7f2a0567d685decde84f34b345fa1827bd3d8ac5

commit_message:
Added to ability to set mtu for lxcbr0

The lxc_host role overrides the configuration
done by the system administrator on the host.

If mtu was defined in /etc/lxc/ and in the
system network interfaces, then these configurations
will be overriden.

This commit should allow the deployer to set the
mtu for its lxcbr0 network, by setting the variable
lxc_net_mtu.

Change-Id: I42ab3d0a2c20ae94335de195cdb14579d9f59f5f
Fixes-Bug: #1518303

commit_message:
increase cryptography from 1.0.1 to 1.1

cryptography <1.0.2 has an issue where asserts can be optimized away.
This could cause an issue where invalid response codes could result
in undefined behavior or worse.

Change-Id: Id626db6b21bf5dc7e686875d47f45a61feb96e1e

commit_message:
Update decider spec to allow specifying which atoms to skip

If the decider function doesn't know to accept the new arguments,
it falls back on the old behavior.

Change-Id: Ibf9b909bcb85c9edc6ca1f0b7f58870978ed05b5

commit_message:
Fix broken ENABLED_SERVICES in neutron and scalpels jobs

- Fix missing comma between n-sch and q-svc
- Use OVERRIDE_ENABLED_SERVICES instead, as it seems like the
  intention of the original change [1]

Note that this effectively remove the following from ENABLED_SERVICES:

    c-api
    c-bak
    c-sch
    c-vol
    ceilometer-acentral
    ceilometer-acompute
    ceilometer-alarm-evaluator
    ceilometer-alarm-notifier
    ceilometer-anotification
    ceilometer-api
    ceilometer-collector
    cinder
    dstat
    horizon
    q-fwaas
    q-lbaas
    q-metering
    quantum
    s-account
    s-container
    s-object
    s-proxy

[1] Iccba951301d2c09e01b6c1a15ed1e88c8e0db69e

Change-Id: I29e3e098bd972b88551db70e280aa86facbd8f42

commit_message:
influxdb.conf location different for 0.9.5

Also, it is installed in /usr/bin so there is no /opt/influxdb. So, put
influxdb setup script in /opt/monasca

Also, data directory is different for 0.9.5. Use /var/lib/influxdb instead
of /var/opt/influxdb

Change-Id: Id60be4842d5f62481af5dfbb930c226666a8678b

subject: bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-01 10:57:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event

Details on the issue in bug #1517480.

We need to subscribe to port before_delete events, because
on after_delete events the port is already removed from the db
and we can't retrieve the binding:host_id information (which
is not passed in the event either).

This change also include a unit test against this bug, which also
happens to go through the ML2 RPC-to-registry codepaths so that
the effect of real registry events against our code are tested, thus
testing the validity of the expectation that the bagpipe driver code
has against ML2. This addresses bug #1493901.

One test is not passing, and thus commented out: see bug 1519258.

Closes-Bug: 1517480
Closes-Bug: 1493901

Conflicts:

commit_message:
bagpipe: port delete action on BEFORE_DELETE event

Details on the issue in bug #1517480.

We need to subscribe to port before_delete events, because
on after_delete events the port is already removed from the db
and we can't retrieve the binding:host_id information (which
is not passed in the event either).

This change also include a unit test against this bug, which also
happens to go through the ML2 RPC-to-registry codepaths so that
the effect of real registry events against our code are tested, thus
testing the validity of the expectation that the bagpipe driver code
has against ML2. This addresses bug #1493901.

One test is not passing, and thus commented out: see bug 1519258.

Change-Id: Icce89d98bcc4424529dcbe661fed3c1c8191418c

commit_message:
Setup cluster setting by chosen components

Modifying cluster creation API (POST /api/clusters) for handling
components data and setup proper values of cluster attributes by
components from wizard. Change storage components metadata.

Implements: blueprint component-registry
Change-Id: Ic2b6774881aab47b5a0914518c5f5db9ab28f3b6

commit_message:
API for master node level dashboard links

This patch inroduces set of API handlers for links to
the plugin dashboards that running on the master node:

plugins/:plugin_id/links/

Implements blueprint external-dashboard-links-support-in-nailgun
Closes-Bug: #1520287

commit_message:
[Rally] temporary turn off requirements job

Rally team wants to cut last release with py26 support, but we can't do
it due to dropped support of py26 in several openstack libraries.

Our plan:
 - turn off requirements-check
 - fix local(rally) requirements
 - cut new release
 - turn on requirements-check

Change-Id: I0c5e4d5ee9455641e3db55e5e2b43618683d93e5

commit_message:
Assign restricted networks to existing nodes

Newly added network groups with restrictions should be assigned to
interfaces on existing nodes after creation.

Change-Id: Ief81f41201ed019d21f31dd01f9801e7e582cc45
Closes-bug: #1517127

subject: Add OpenContrail driver
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-01 10:57:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add OpenContrail driver

That version uses the key/value store exposed by the OpenContrail
API but that's not efficient. The BGP/VPN resources and sub-association
need to be added to the OpenContrail data model.

commit_message:
Add OpenContrail driver

That version uses the key/value store exposed by the OpenContrail
API but that's not efficient. The BGP/VPN resources and sub-association
need to be added to the OpenContrail data model.

That first PoC will be delivered to with the Liberty release but will be
replaced by a final one for Mitaka and next releases without any
migration script or method from the first PoC version.

Implements: blueprint opencontrail-bgpvpn-driver
Change-Id: I3795dd7b24afdac1cd5134c41b6b32ef8a888287

commit_message:
[Ironic] Configure neutron-server only on controllers

Since new role Ironic added and requires OVS agent, condition of
neutron-server installations should be changed.
In case if ironic node is not combined with controller, it has no
neutron-server.

Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic

Change-Id: I31624c9bbe7857f7a78e8a7911766668af2aa74b

commit_message:
[WIP] Enable TLS reception for rsyslog server

This patch enables TLS log reception for the rsyslog server installed by
openstack-ansible. This also opens the door for various rsyslog clients
to use encrypted connections to transmit logs.

Closes-bug: 1510154

Change-Id: I7297dcb52b09cf22d27150a14a4cd4912cd39f3e

subject: Remove py26 support
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 07:58:33.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I8c1e5765228382c9982883320568fe729d0c35f8
Closes-Bug: 1519510
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove py26 support

as of mitaka, the infra team won't have the resources available to
reasonably test py26, also the oslo team is dropping py26 support
from their libraries. sine we rely on oslo for a lot of our work,
and depend on infra for our CI, we should drop py26 support too.

Change-Id: I8c1e5765228382c9982883320568fe729d0c35f8
Closes-Bug: 1519510

fix error reporting for bad SHA

Fix the way the error message is constructed when there is a bad SHA to
the error is reported instead of seeing a KeyError.

Change-Id: I5ff521dee807d3497b2d3496f4361c8fad57d86e

commit_message:
Make auth_version not hardcoded

This change reads the auth_version from the configs. This means that
the keystone version is not hardcoded and will update as users change
the keystone version used in the configs eg. keystone v2 to keystone
v3. This causes this code to become more future proof, for version
changes in keystone.

Change-Id: I33e757becf9cccd9b6ee607068c2326e4afe472c
Closes-bug: 1507991

commit_message:
Disable heat api cloudwatch

This shouldn't be required and will save us around
50Mb of memory in an undercloud deployment.

Change-Id: I63d551fee1e862c0579ab1d5e9c1520508e7b0ef

fuel-createmirror is replaced by fuel-mirror

fuel-package-updates is also replaced by fuel-mirror

Depends-On: #I296a5f356ca805deda28ea984df15c0b63b43a80
Closes-Bug: #1487077
Implements: blueprint refactor-local-mirror-scripts
Doc-Impact

commit_message:
Make enabling of controller services configurable.

Following parameters will be user configurable:
1. enable_dhcp_agent
2. enable_metadta_agent
3. enable_l3_agent
4. enable_ovs_agent

This change was made as the Nuage plugin does not require these
services to come up as a part of the installation.
Now, a user can explicitly disable these services using a heat
template.

Change-Id: Ic132ecbb2e81a3746f304da1cecdc66d0342db72

Added ExtraConfig templates and environment files
 for Nuage Networks specific parameters.
Modified overcloud_compute.pp to conditionally
 include nuage-metadata-agent.

include Nuage plugin and agents.

commit_message:
do not commit requirements syncs

We need to test without committing the requirements changes because pbr
throws an error if the pre and post versioning do not match. The first
change on a stable branch must be the one to remove the pre-versioning
configuration.

Change-Id: I812af614b7a6c7f499c67310f078ac4835b9e91a
(cherry picked from commit cd88f6c3f639dea3370c6c4b4178e77b14a3b4e2)

commit_message:
do not commit requirements syncs

We need to test without committing the requirements changes because pbr
throws an error if the pre and post versioning do not match. The first
change on a stable branch must be the one to remove the pre-versioning
configuration.

Change-Id: I812af614b7a6c7f499c67310f078ac4835b9e91a
(cherry picked from commit cd88f6c3f639dea3370c6c4b4178e77b14a3b4e2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-01 13:53:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix pylint breakage for kilo

pylint depends on the astroid package, which has updated to v1.4.1
and that is incompatible with pylint 1.4.4. To prevent breakage,
we are pinning astroid to 1.3.8 on kilo branch (and pinning pylint
to 1.4.4).

It is expected that pylint will not be updated on this branch.

Change-Id: I276126b9ed3c1aec70e32cd582bb0f891d90e007
Depends-On: Iaf2c5dbb92cacbc236083f8f6926a426bfb28f21
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-01 20:06:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix pylint breakage for kilo

Using test-requirements.txt to pin pylint to 1.4.4 and astroid (a
dependency) to less than 1.4.0, as newer versions break pylint.

It is expected that pylint will not be updated on this branch.

Change-Id: I276126b9ed3c1aec70e32cd582bb0f891d90e007

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-12-02 08:49:15.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix pylint breakage for kilo

Using test-requirements.txt to pin pylint to 1.4.4 and astroid (a

Change-Id: I276126b9ed3c1aec70e32cd582bb0f891d90e007
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Fix pylint breakage for kilo

Using test-requirements.txt to pin pylint to 1.4.4 and astroid (a
dependency) to less than 1.4.0, as newer versions break pylint.

It is expected that pylint will not be updated on this branch.

Change-Id: I276126b9ed3c1aec70e32cd582bb0f891d90e007

subject: Cap astroid to unbreak pylint.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-01 18:27:20.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Cap astroid to unbreak pylint.

While projects run different versions of pylint, astroid which is a pylint
dependency has done an API breaking point release - 1.4.{0,1} breaks pylint
1.4.4.

Since this is a stable branch, I'm just capping everything, we have no
expectation of projects in stable branches revising their pylint versions.

Upstream bug url: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issues/275/140-and-141-fail-to-work-with-pylint-144

nb: the upstream response is that astroid 1.4 is deliberately breaking
and should have been 2.0.

Change-Id: Iaf2c5dbb92cacbc236083f8f6926a426bfb28f21
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cap astroid to unbreak pylint.

While projects run different versions of pylint, astroid which is a pylint
dependency has done an API breaking point release - 1.4.{0,1} breaks pylint
1.4.4.

Since this is a stable branch, I'm just capping everything, we have no
expectation of projects in stable branches revising their pylint versions.

Upstream bug url: https://bitbucket.org/logilab/astroid/issues/275/140-and-141-fail-to-work-with-pylint-144

nb: the upstream response is that astroid 1.4 is deliberately breaking
and should have been 2.0.

Change-Id: Iaf2c5dbb92cacbc236083f8f6926a426bfb28f21

commit_message:
Add tests to update group with few fields

Keystone group update operation allow to update
the few fields and keeping others as it is.

Adding tests to check that behavior.

commit_message:
Add reexecute_on parameter to needed tasks

Sometimes we need to re-execute some tasks on all nodes, including
already deployed ondes, on deploy changes. The major use case is
adding/removing node network group(s) when we need to reconfigure
routing on all nodes.

So tasks that have 'deploy_changes' in their 'reexecute_on' list
will be re-executed by nailgun on 'ready' nodes and thus update
network/firewall setup on them.

Case with adding controllers is handled separately and we run all
deployment tasks in such case.

It's related to change-id: I668fcb426826cecf69a5c7fc1e92b8ae8dfeef9f
Blueprint: redeploy-network-on-changes

Change-Id: I4e9c4c3ae4f4f9552e068bc4cd1a117b3da87ab6

to be told to get neutron stable/liberty branch.

commit_message:
Virtual guest device role tagging

This will provide a mechanism for the user to tag a device they
have assigned to their guest with a specific role. The tag will
be matched to the hardware address of the device and this mapping
exposed to the guest OS via metadata service/cloud-init

APIImpact
Change-Id: I16845bd36878bbd9d7a877dc556b2650bc6f0fad

commit_message:
Lock nodes to avoid simultaneous introspection requests

Now a NodeInfo object has a lock instance attached, which is associated
with a node UUID. New calls acquire_lock and release_lock are added.
NodeInfo.find_node now always acquire a lock, get_node does it optionally.
NodeInfo.finished now always release a lock.

Note that this change does not make NodeInfo thread-safe. Rather it's
preventing simultaneous operations on the same node.

Change-Id: I0c0bd2f4e0622fd7086660b0874c5b8dca82b4d2
Implements: blueprint node-state

commit_message:
Partition preservation scope for RF

Cover reinstall procedure for Reduced Footprint feaure:

1) fuel node --node 1 --disk --download
2) edit disk.yaml (set keep_data to true)
3) fuel node --node 1 --disk --upload
4) provision virt node
5) spawn vms (fuel2 env spawn-vms <env-id>)
6) wait for VMs to comes up
7) deploy virt node

Change-Id: I0c00000453d16d14c28d10f87d066d9890181db0
Closes-Bug: #1505147
